loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia  lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, she is running a general store selling grocery goods in the local community. After 10 years in this business, Virginia earns enough to be able to provide for the needs of her children. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and her previous loan used in her business was successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to boost her store. She will use her loan to purchase more grocery goods for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 25-year-old from Gaza. She is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend a public primary school.

In 2009 she decided to do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. Since then, she has sewn clothes. Her goods are customized according to her client.

Her dream is to open a business with large number of employees working in her business who will have the opportunity to work and get income. 

Amena asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy a laundry steamer and electronic generator. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy laundry steamer and electronic generator.

loans.name: Imee Joy

texts.en:
Imee Joy is from Bita-ug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She is 23 years old and single with 2 children who are infants.

This year, Imee Joy applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to join. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Imee Joy is asking a financial assistance of 14,000 PHP to purchase bags, lotions, Tupperware and accessories. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase bags, lotions, Tupperware and accessories.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, está necesitando capital para invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, arroz, aceite, golosinas, azúcar, bebidas entre otros productos para tener la materia prima para elaborar tortillas para vender y surtir la tienda. 
La inversión anterior le ayudo a que su negocio fuera más competitivo, atendió mejor a sus clientes, genero ingresos con los que ha cancelado las cuotas de su crédito, ha mejorado la alimentación y salud de todos.
texts.en:
José needs capital to invest in buying corn, firewood, rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, sugar, other beverages, and more items for making tortillas to sell and stock up his store.

The last investment helped him to make his business to be more competitive, attend to more customers, generate income, pay off debt, and improve everyone's health and nutrition.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, sugar, and other beverages.

loans.name: Enemesia

texts.en:
Enemesia is 51 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Enemesia is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Enemesia has been raising livestock for 4 years, and she earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, apples, grapes, pears, etc.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is 21 years old. He lives at a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his seven siblings and his parents. Ameen is in his first year studying for a bachelor's degree in English literature. He is planning to continue his studies to find a job in his study field after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. But he doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma was born in 1991. She is engaged and currently lives with her two siblings and her parents. Basma trained to make crafts, baskets, frames and trays from ash. Then she started her own project making them. She has been running this project for one year and found it to be profitable. Now, she wants to expand it by buying a larger quantity of the needed tools like ash and other raw materials to be more productive and to make a larger quantity of items. This will help her earn a better income, which will provide good financial support for her family. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more ash and raw materials to make more crafts

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.ru: Лутфи родилась в 1961 года. Она замужем. Ее муж Абдусаттор добрый человек, который имеет хорошую репутацию среди местного населения. Лутфи имеет 3 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Лутфи уже более 17 лет занимается купле продажей женской одежды. Летом она продает летние платья, а зимой она продает костюмы и теплые кофты. Она торгует на местном рынке. Лутфи имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для покупки женской одежды для пополнения оборотного капитала. Лутфи является повторной клиенткой ИМОН и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Lutfy was born in 1961. She is married. Her husband, Abdusattor, is a kind person who has a good reputation among the local population. Lutfy has three adult children. For more than 17 years, Lutfy has traded in women's clothing. During the summer she sells summer dresses, and in the winter she sells suits and warm sweaters. She trades at the local market. Lutfy has loyal customers. She needs to update her inventory for the new season, but has no money. She is asking for a loan to buy women's clothing. Lutfy is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history.  She is awaiting your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, se encuentra sin capital disponible para invertir en su panadería, comprara harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca y todo lo necesario para seguir trabajando. Con el crédito anterior compro lo necesario para que su negocio funcionara y le diera una producción abundante, mejores ingresos y cancelar sus deudas.
Está trabajando duro para que su negocio siga produciendo cada día más, tener a sus clientes satisfechos, y mejorar las condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Ricardo finds himself without capital to invest in his bakery. He will buy flour, sugar, yeast, shortening and everything else necessary to continue working. With the previous loan he bought everything necessary so that his business would work and would give him abundant production, better income, and so that he could pay off his debts.

He is working hard so that his business continues producing more every day, to have satisfied customers and to improve family conditions.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and shortening.

loans.name: 06.07.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to make rice wine to resell. Xuân is 51 years old and married with two children. Xuân is the group leader of the 06.07.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents since her children are grown up.

This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice to make rice wine to resell

loans.name: 07.03.05 Phú Sơn1 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nụ has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell.

Nụ is 30 years old and married with two children. Nụ is the group leader of the 07.03.05 Phú Sơn1 solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Nụ lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nụ has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nụ has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nụ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 46 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Judith has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other gear for her business.

Judith has been in this business for 20 years. Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and other gear for her business.

loans.name: Karent Emilcen

texts.es:
Karent  es una mujer de 32, vive con su familia, se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y ademas posee una tienda que la administra. Karent se caso y tuvo dos niños de 8 años el barón y la niña tiene 6 años de edad los dos estudian, su esposo ya no esta con ellos, tuvo que emigrar a los estados unidos para poder mantener bien a su familia.

Ella hoy vive con los padres, su papá se dedica a la ganadería y su madre a los quehaceres de la casa; ella realizo los estudio hasta segunda año de la universidad, cuando se caso dejo de estudiar. 

Ella a tenido la tienda desde hace 6 años,  tiene otra actividad que es la venta de la leche que saca su padre del ganado que posee.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar producto para surtir la tienda y para terminar de pagar la primera deuda que adquirió con la fundación campo.  

Los sueño que la señora tiene es que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios y que puedan culminar una carrera universitaria, también mejorara poco a poco la tienda para  mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Karent is a 32 year-old woman, she lives with her family and makes her living doing the chores of her house and additionally owns a store that she runs. Karent got married and had two children: the son is 8 and the daughter is 6, both study. Her husband is no longer with them; he had to emigrate to the United States to be able to maintain his family well.

Today she lives with her parents. Her father works in cattle raising and her mother does the chores of the house. Karent studied up until the second year of university. When she married she stopped studying.

She has had the store for 6 years. She has another business, which is the sale of the milk that her father gets from the cattle he owns.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy products to stock the store and to finish paying the first loan that she acquired from Fundación Campo.

loans.use: to buy products to stock the store and to finish paying off the first loan that she acquired from Fundación Campo.

loans.name: Alice E

texts.en: Alice has helped her husband on their farm planting and harvesting rice for a living. She has been borrowing and using loans from GDMPC micro credit for the farm. Alice is thankful that she earned good returns from her farm and that she has successfully repaid her previous loans. Currently, she requests a  loan to purchase a new variety of seeds and fertilizer to improve the rice fields. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds and fertilizer.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María, es una señora de 59 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos, ya son mayores, vive junto a uno de sus hijos, aprendió de su mamá a administrar granjas, hoy ella lo hace de forma independiente, todos los días trabaja.  Los pollos los engorda, luego los aliña para venderlos por piezas.
Invertirá en la comprará pollos, concentrado y vitaminas, esto le dará la oportunidad de tener una granja equipada para enfrentar las demandas de pollo para las graduaciones escolares y fiestas de fin de año. Aumentará su  producción, sus ganancias serán mayores, y cancelara sus deudas.
Anhela tener un negocio más rentable, mejorar su economía y darle una mejor alimentación a su familia.
texts.en:
María, is a 59 year old woman. She is single and has two children, who are grown. She lives with one of them. She learned from her how mother to farm. Today she does this independently, working every day. She fattens chickens and later seasons them to sell them in pieces.

Maria will use the loan to buy chickens concentrated feed and vitamins. This will allow her to have a farm well equipped to meet the demand for chicken for school graduations and end of the year festivals. She will increase her production, her revenues will be greater and she will pay off her debt.

Maria dreams of having a more profitable business, improving her finances and be able to feed her family better.

loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un crédito para pagar la recolección de la cosecha y también la maquinaria para desgranar el maíz, con el crédito anterior tuvo producción, aumentó sus ingresos, cumplió con los pedidos de sus clientes y cancelo sus deudas.
El mejoro su economía, les da una mejor alimentación a su familia, todos están saludables y le brindan apoyo para realizar sus actividades.
texts.en: Juan is requesting a loan to pay to harvest his crops and also to pay for the threshing of his corn. With his last loan he increased his production and his revenues, fulfilled the demand of his clients and paid off his debt. He improved his financial situation and can feed his family better. All of his family are well and they support him in carrying out his activities.

loans.use: to pay to harvest his crops and pay for machinery to thresh his corn.

loans.name: Wasayef

texts.en: Because Wasayef is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Wasayef was born in 1962. She is a widowed woman who lives in  a sector in Jordan called Salt with her four children. Her husband was a driver. One of Wasayef's sons is studying for a Bachelor of Regional Planning. He is in his second year and he also works at the same time. Her son is planning to find a better job after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially after their father’s death. But Wasayef doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en: Because Suzan is a conservative woman she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Suzan was born in 1969. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh with her husband and her five children. Her husband is a driver. One of Suzan's’ sons is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting. He is in his last year and is planning to work in his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. He is only one step closer to reaching his goal. But Suzan doesn’t have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a 36-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She sells cocoa and food such as maize and tomatoes and has been in this business for four years.  She is challenged by the seasonal changes which affects her output. Her future plans are to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and to build a permanent house for her family since she is the sole income earner.

Miria is requesting a the loan to buy cocoa and food to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover school fees and to buy study materials for her son.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 47-years-old and married with two children. Marciana works very hard to provide for them.

Marciana runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional stock to sell at her general store.

Marciana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, sanitary napkins, etc. 

In the future, Marciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Estrella Del Rosario

texts.es:
Estrella, es una madre que disfruta ver crecer a su pequeña hija, ella lucha por sacarla adelante y darle lo mejor que puede, sabe que la responsabilidad es solo de ella, pues es madre soltera, vive junto a su madre y su hija, se dedica a vender tortillas, trabaja todos los días, es una actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para ayudar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa.
Con la inversión comprará una plancha, con lo que espera aumentar su producción, vender más tortillas, atraer a más clientes, cancelar la deuda y seguir aportando con los gastos de su casa.
Desea en un futuro tener a parte de la venta de tortillas poder instalar un comedor, que mejoraría en gran medida  su economía.
texts.en:
Estrella is a mother who enjoys watching her child grow. She fights to get ahead and gives her all she can. She is the only person responsible for her daughter as she is a single mother. She lives with her mother and her daughter. She sells tortillas. She works daily and has done this for the last two years as she had to have a way to help her mother with the household expenses.

Estrella will buy a grill with the loan. She hopes to increase her production, attract more clients, pay off her debts and continue to help with the household expenses.

She hopes to open an eatery, besides selling tortillas in the future. This would improve her financial situation a lot.

loans.use: to buy a grill.

loans.name: Carmen Zenovia

texts.es: Carmen agradece a todos los inversionistas que le ayudaron con el crédito y se siente muy contenta de ser parte de este proyecto, ella continua viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y continúa dedicándose a la venta de frutas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas como piñas y plátanos. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Carmen is grateful to all the investors who helped with her loan and is very happy to be a part of this project. She still lives in the city of Salvación and still earns a living by selling fruit. She has been doing this for several years now,and the business is going well thanks to her determination. 

Carmen belongs to the "Las Palmeras del Manu" communal bank and, on this occasion, is requesting a loan in order to buy fruit such as pineapples and bananas. She is grateful for and knows the value of this loan, and is committed to making her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as pineapples and bananas.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 30 years old and a villager from Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. For her family, the primary sources of income are from rice farming and a part-time part time job as a paid worker. This is the second microloan for Mom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to do her rice farming on schedule and keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she has formed a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she will receive triple yield in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Noora

texts.en: Noora was born in 1962. She is a widowed woman who lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her four children. Noora has been trying her best to support her children financially after her husband's death. She has been selling home products for one year. She started her project with a small quantity of them. She considered her work as a good source of income to support her children and cover their needs. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of home products to raise her profits. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Hélène Nathalie

texts.fr: Hélène est  une jeune femme de 29 ans fiancée. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 5 ans déjà, elle fait aussi le surfilage mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter la surfileuse, des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Hélène is a young woman, 29 years old and engaged. After her training, she opened a small sewing workshop that has been doing well for the past 5 years She also does the overcasting but does not have the equipment to process orders faster and satisfy her customers in time. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy the overcasting machine, fabric, and little sewing materials (pins, needles, lining, thread ...), avoiding going to the market all the time, so that she could sew and sell to her customers. The income from this loan will allow her not only to buy her little sewing materials to grow her business, but also to meet some of her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a surfileuse [a machine for overcasting] and a small sewing kit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, seeds.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en: Marciano is married and a father of five school-aged dependents. Marciano is a farmer that plants and harvests rice for a living.  He has been engaged in this activity for more than nine years, making a good living for the family. Marciano used his previous loans to finance his farm, and was able to repay successfully. Aside from this, he has cultivated an additional plot of rice for expansion. Now, he requests a new loan to purchase fertilizer in order to have a greener farm. Marciano is determined to gain more profit from his effort and investments. Hopefully, in the near future, his family will make a better living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María es una persona de 35 años de edad posee una familia bien establecida junto a su esposo, el cual posee ya una edad avanzada, tienen 3 hijas 16 , 12, y 5 años , las cuales estudian y su propósito es finalizar sus estudios , la cliente se puede mencionar que es un pilar fundamental en el hogar , siendo ella quien vela por su familia .


Además de realizar sus oficios domésticos, la señora también es un apoyo para su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas, ya que por sus escasos recursos y los problemas de salud de su esposo se dificulta cancelar mano de obra, por lo cual de vez en cuando su presencia es indispensable.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar especies menores (cerdos), pretende comprar entre 4 y 5 cerdos para crecerlos y buscar un ingreso que les permita solventar el compromiso a la fecha de vencimiento del crédito, la idea surge tomando en cuenta que habrá cosecha abundante y facilita la crianza.

María manifiesta que su prioridad siempre será su familia y que todo lo que realiza es proyectando un futuro para ellos,  pretende mantener siempre esta mano amiga para continuar su lucha.
texts.en:
María is thirty-five years old. She and her husband, who is now older, have a well-established family. They have three daughters, aged five, twelve, and sixteen years old, who are students and have the goal of completing their studies. María says that she is a cornerstone of the household since she is the one who watches over the family. 

Besides taking care of the housework, she also helps her husband with farm work: due to limited resources and her husband's health problems, it is difficult to pay for labor. For this reason, her presence is vital.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy small farm animals (pigs). She hopes to buy four or five pigs to fatten for an income that will allow her to repay her loan obligation at the maturity date. This idea is emerging by taking into account that there will be an abundant harvest which will make raising the pigs easier.

María says that her family is always her priority and that everything she does is to build a future for them. She hopes to always carry on with this helping hand to continue her fight.

loans.use: to buy four or five pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is 43 years old and has four children. Maria Flor is married and has one child who is still in school.

Maria Flor is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Maria Flor requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Flor has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

Maria Flor would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marilyn has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish for her business

loans.name: Karen Waldina

texts.es:
La joven Karen  es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y  humilde,  vive junto a sus hermanos y su madre en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una glorieta donde vende comidas y también  da el servicio  de internet  el cual es muy conocido en su colonia. 
Karen  necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como  carnes,  refrescos,  agua, plátanos, papas, churros y un tóner este último para su negocio de internet. Espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos  necesarios para seguir realizando sus actividades y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
 Karen le gustaría que sus ventas  aumentaran  y que  se vea reflejado en su  calidad de vida  y de su familia, uno de sus sueños es que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad  y  de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre   del  2013
texts.en:
Karen is a very hard-working, responsible, and humble young woman. She lives with her siblings and her mother in a community in the southern part of Honduras. Her business is a food stall, where she sells meals and also provides Internet service, which is very well-known in her colony.

Karen needs the loan for purchasing merchandise, such as meat, soft drink, water, plantains, potatoes, and churros, as well as toner for her Internet provider business. She hopes that thanks to the loan she will be able to have the necessary products to continue doing her work and meet customer demand.

Karen would like her sales to increase and her family’s quality of life and her own quality of life to improve as well. One of her dreams is that her business will continue growing and become the most well-known in the community so she can continue supporting her family.



Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to purchase meat, soft drink, water, plantains, potatoes, churros, and toner for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cheese and transport it to the capital

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen is 61 years old and a mother of eight children. As the only breadwinner in the family, she does paddy rice farming as the main source of income and supplements her income via selling fermented rice paste called “Tror Pe” in Khmer language. 

Phen has been involved in her current business for more than 20 years. Now her son wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in management. Thus, she applies for this education loan to cover the tuition fee and to buy a decent computer for her son. This is the original loan for Phen with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover tuition fees and to buy a decent computer for her son

loans.name: Bon

texts.en:
Bon is 43 years old and a widow residing in Kampong Cham province. She has two children to support as they are still in school. For the sake of her children, she grows cassava as their single source of income, as she has done for several years. It has returned her about $3 per day. 

Bon, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for past three cycles during which she has fully repaid all loans, is applying for an education loan for daughter who wants to pursue the bachelor's degree, majoring in Mathematics. Bon hopes that this financial support will enable her daughter to reach her dream of becoming a mathematics teacher and getting a decent income to support her living.

loans.use: To cover the school fee for her daughter

loans.name: Zeeshan

texts.en:
Zeeshan is a 24-year-old who lives with his family (mother, wife, and five children) in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2006, Zeeshan has been running a winter items shop in his village. He became experienced in his work and now is able to open a shop in the central bazaar. Due to lack of funding, he can't open the new shop in the central bazaar as he desired. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. In this case he has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan, he can buy a variety of goods like blankets, foam, etc., for his shop, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Zeeshan and his family are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy winter goods.

loans.name: Margalita

texts.en:
Margalita is 37 years old and married with two children. Her parents-in-law live with her as well. Margalita is the only employed person in the household. Specifically, she works as a cleaner at a governmental institution in return for a small monthly salary. Her salary is hardly enough to cover household expenses, so the family decided to start a store where plumbing accessories and construction materials will be sold. 

When she receives the loan, Margalita will a buy stock of merchandise and start working. She and her husband will work as salespersons and generate income. Margalita has already rented the commercial store and wishes to start business soon.

She hopes that the Kiva loan will change her life and that her family members will have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start a plumbing store

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the  region of Kampala North in Uganda. He is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past six years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential home-use commodities. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more essential home-use commodities, and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more essential home-use commodities,

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is 34 years old – a widow woman living with her brother-in-law and her two children. She lost her husband more than six years ago due to a disease which he had been suffering from for the last 10 years. Pratima's husband was running a small grocery shop and, after her husband's death, Pratima took up this business. Her brother-in-law helps her to run this grocery shop. He brings grocery items from the nearby market.

From this business, Pratima earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. She is facing lots of financial problems with monthly household expenses and her brother-in-law's study. Now she wants to buy grocery items in bulk so she can manage more items in her shop. She has requested a loan of 15,000 INR for purchasing sugar, tea, biscuits, edible oil, spices, etc. She wants to provide her family the basic necessities of living and save some money for her children's studies.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing sugar, tea, biscuits, edible oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 25 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Amos, who earns some additional income for the family. They do not have any children yet.

She has been running her photography business for one year. To enable her to purchase a photo printing machine, she has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is 15,000 KES and she has plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy video machines and to pay back her loan to KADET Ltd. Sarah's hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to excel and to prosper.

loans.use: to buy a photo printing machine

loans.name: En-En

texts.en:
En-En is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. En-En is 34 years old and her four children are in school.

En-En has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

En-En has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 48 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. Thelma has been in pig fattening business for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her agriculture business.

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Melania es una señora originaria de la ciudad de Granada, madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de mini pulpería y venta de hot dog, el cual ha conseguido tener un negocio con mejores condiciones y ha podido salir adelante. Esta agradecida con kiva y Micrédito ya que mantiene un negocio próspero y un nivel más alto de ventas. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, jabones entre otros, con el fin de seguir creciendo su negocio. Estima que este crédito le será de mucho beneficio ya que podrá cubrir con la diversidad de mercadería, y ofertar más productos.
texts.en:
Melania is a native of the city of Granada and the mother of two children. 

She is a merchant who makes her living with a mini-grocery store business, and by selling hot dogs, which has allowed her to have a business with better conditions and get ahead. She is grateful to Kiva and microcredit because it maintains a thriving business with a higher level of sales. 

She is asking for a new loan to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, sugar and soap, among others, in order to continue growing her business. She believes that this loan will be very beneficial to her because she will be able to cover a diversity or merchandise and offer more products.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, sugar and soap, among others.

loans.name: Rab Nawaz

texts.en:
Rab Nawaz is 45 years old. He lives with his family, a daughter and 4 sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 200 he has had a general store and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. In this case, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. 

He can buy a variety of goods for his general store to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for a better future for his children.

Rab Nawaz and his family are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To pay for a variety of goods for his general store.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is aged 28 years and married with two children and is from a rural village from the Moung Russey district of Cambodia.  To make a living, she has been farming rice and selling grocery items.  The current business earns her about 24,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sokha has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is asking for a loan of 1,200,000KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income for better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Thom province, Cheng is a 50-year-old mother and has seven children. Nowadays, all of her children still rely on her as they are still in school. She strives for a living via seven hectares of rice farming and a pig-raising business. This business has returned her about US $7 per day. Cheng is quite new to VisionFund. She applies for a loan for the purpose of paying her son's school fee. She hopes that her son continues the bachelor's degree in marketing (his major) and gets a good job to support the family.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university school fee.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn is 38 years old and married. He is a father of one son who dependends on him. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice for 10 years and supplement their family’s income by selling grocery items. 
Lorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles. He successfully paid back the past loans. Now he is applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the university tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is a 29-year-old differently-able person living with his parents and three siblings. He is the elder brother among his siblings. He started a grocery shop more than four years ago. He earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this business. He has four years of experience in this grocery shop. From his earnings, he helps his father support his family. He sells items like rice, edible oil, grains, sugar, soap, hair oil and spices in his shop. There are approximately 120 families living in his village that are dependent on his shop for daily household necessities, but he is unable to meet his customers' demands as his shop is small and has limited stock. Sarat wants to enhance his business by stocking up on more of what he sells and adding some more items, such as detergents, toothbrushes, toothpaste, electric bulbs, etc., to his shop.

Sarat has a plan to purchase the goods in bulk so that it will reduce his transportation and buying costs. He has requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase rice, edible oil, grains, sugar, soap, hair oil, spices, detergents, toothbrushes, toothpaste, electric bulbs, etc. He hopes it will help to increase the customer base for his shop, and he can earn more money. He wants to save some money for his future.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing rice, edible oil, grains, sugar, soap, hair oil, spices, detergents, toothbrushes, toothpaste, electric bulbs, etc.

loans.name: Jemal

texts.en:
Jemal is 50 years old. He is from the village of Khetsubani in west Georgia. He lives with his wife, two grown-up sons, and retired parents. At the present, Jemal is unemployed and seeking a job. There is a high unemployment rate in the region among people over 40, and it has become hard for Jemal to find suitable work. 

The source for the family is a small seasonal income from an agricultural business; in particular, Jemal grows citrus, nuts, and persimmons for sale. Jemal’s wife has a chronic health problems and needs medical service fees. It is for this reason that he has decided to start his own business. He plans to begin trading in food products, but he needs a van in order to make deliveries. 

With the loan, Jemal will pay for the van and start buying various fruits and vegetables to sell in the local market. He will work hard to develop his business. Jemal is a very hardworking man with a great desire to ensure that his family members have good living conditions. He will earn a good income in order to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use for making product deliveries.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old from Gaza. He has been working in a blacksmith's workshop since the time he left his school in the ninth grade to help his poor family.

In 2009, he started his own business to improve his living and increase his income. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it. Ahmad applied for a youth loan from a Kiva field partner to buy a welding machine for his business and to register his business.
He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income to be able have a family in the future .

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for his business and to register his business.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is married with two children residing in the village of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur. She has been raising pigs for five years earning well enough to augment their living. She raised numbers of pigs in her piggery, which she needs financially to continue running her business. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed for the livestock. She is hopeful enough to gain more profit from her effort and investments. In the future, Jovelyn wants to improve the general living of the entire family and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Kasongodde Twegatte Farmers' Group

texts.en: Eldad, with his hand raised, is a member of Kasongodde Twegatte Group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He is 58 years old and the father of six children. His spouse is a business woman and they live in their own three bedroom house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started his business while selling maize flour and milling with capital that he got through the group. Now he has a maize, cassava, and millet milling machine as part of his fixed capital. He faces challenges of customers who fail to pay their debts and power fluctuations. His goal is to have a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year. Eldad intends to use the loan to buy fuel for the maize milling machine.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the maize milling machine.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a lady of twenty three years, married to Samson, and together they have one child. She sells cereals in Kiambaa in the outskirt of Limuru town. She has been in this business for one year now, and gets a monthly income of five thousand Shillings.

This will be Faith's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy assorted cereals for her business. In the future, she wants to educate her child and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted cereals.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai, 48, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has four children. For the last seven years, Thai and her husband have been farming rice and growing corn as the main sources of the family’s income. Thai is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fee. She hopes this loan will help her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fee.

loans.name: Rann's Group

texts.en:
Rann is 22 years old and married. She lives in the rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been buying and selling cows in her village for several years. The current business earns her about 84,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Rann’s group consists of two members who are just with VisoinFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more cows to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her business to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca is a mother of six children and a business woman trading veterinary drugs in a trading centre in Kyabugimbi. She started selling drugs in 2008 with the objective of generating income which would supplement her hard and small earned salary. Prisca would like to use the loan money amounting to two million shillings only to buy veterinary drugs which she hopes to sell at a profit to animal farmers who buy the drugs to treat their animals. Prisca believes that her business will expand with time since she will inject some more money which will result in big profits.  Her challenge is mainly un-recovered debts which reduce her income in a given period but even with the challenges at hand, she is determined to work harder and educate her children and give them a bright future.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Born

texts.en:
Born is a 42-year-old father of four children and a resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district. The main sources of the family’s income are from raising pigs and selling rice soup in the village.
 
This is the third loan for Born with Kiva partner, VisionFund. Born successfully paid back the loans with VisionFund. Now he is asking for a loan to buy pig feed for his pigs and to buy ingredients for making rice soup. He hopes that this loan will enable him to earn more income for his family so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Sagida

texts.en:
Sagida is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration. Here is her story.
“There are lots of different paths in life. Each person chooses his own through which he will go till the end of his life. Certainly, there are such periods when human beings come to the end of the path and make life-changing decisions. By deciding we choose our path and further life. I would like to get good quality knowledge in order to make come true all my subsequent life plans. That is why when choosing the path I already know which one to choose, this turn, part of my life is AUCA. During studying at high school, I have changed three schools due to family reasons. Level of education varied in each one of them. Until fifth grade I studied at "Bokonbaeva" school which is located in Osh. The knowledge which I received there was enough for me to pass admission exams to the Kyrgyz-Turkish high school. Three years of my studies at the lyceum clearly demonstrated that I learned twice as much as at the old one. Seeing the difference I clearly understood that my professional goals can be achieved only if I have good quality education. My parents always said and taught that knowledge that I receive is a key to success, and that number of keys will depend on what type of doors for the future I wish to open for myself and maybe even for the country. To study at AUCA was my dream and I am happy to become part of it now. In order to be able to study at AUCA I have to be competitive and need to improve the level of my English. I started going to the English language courses at "Education for All" (SOROS). Also, I started taking TOEFL preparation course and studied math on a regular basis with my sister who worked as a teacher at my first school. I think that these efforts did not go in vain, at the end of this school year I will finish my English course in advanced group at "Education for All" and have no doubts of receiving a good score on the exams which will be taken.


I also hope to hold a key to AUCA doors which later will open more doors for other opportunities. Studies at AUCA will definitely give me enough knowledge in order to achieve my goals and bring plans to reality. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to its students one of which is Kiva loan and it gives students a good chance to study here. All the students that need a financial aid are eligible to apply for it and mostly they are awarded a loan. I am also applying for a loan, so that I am able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for my higher education.

loans.name: Al-Smoo Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Smoo; it consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking woman. They have applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB. Latifa is the leader of this group. She is a married woman and the mother of two children; one of them is enrolled in school. Latifa tirelessly worked as a hairdresser and attracted new clientele. Her living conditions improved, and so did her income. She owns a small house. She started by buying a small piece of land. This took great effort on her part. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials to use for her house. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use for her house.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey, 49, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, and she is married with seven children. The main sources of income for the family are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 25 years. The current business earns her about 62,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Srey has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her relieve the family burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Beth Kanini

texts.en:
Beth is a 44-year-old widow and a mother of three children aged 15, eight, and seven years old. She is in a transport business in Naivasha, which she has operated for one year with an average monthly income of KES 40,000. She has applied for a fourth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy stock of tires for sale. With anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to be the biggest tire supplier in Maai Mahiu.

loans.use: To buy tires for sale for her retail business.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district, Eam is aged 21 years and married. She has one son. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer and she also grows corn. Eam is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now, she is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition fees to study university, in the law discipline. She hopes that the loan will keep her in university to pursue the degree, so as to find a good job after graduation and also help her to relieve her financial burden.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees to study at university.

loans.name: Torng's Group

texts.en:
Torng is 34 years old and blessed with one little son who is too young for school. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice farming and a pig-raising business. To earn extra income for her entire household, she also works for others for a fee. The business that she has had for several years earns her about 22,200 KHR per day. 

Torng is a second-time borrower, whereas her joint borrower is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The former loan that Torng repaid back completely enabled her to buy pigs to raise to supplement her income. For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes that she can get a good yield from her crops and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years now. Elisa works hard to support her family. 

Elisa requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en: Davit is 34-year-old married man. He lives in Kobuleti district with his wife and two children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows, whose milk is used in cheese production to sell locally. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. Davit is a very hard working man and always has high quality products which he sells to local retailers. As the income is seasonal, David decided to start a taxi business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 GEL to install gas equipment in his car. As soon as the gas is installed in his car, he will be able to start a taxi business and transport people to generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for his family.

loans.use: to install gas equipment in his taxi car.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is aged 31 years old and married and lives in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband have two children. They earn a living through farming rice and making snacks and they have been in these businesses for four years. With the current businesses, she and her husband are able to earn approximately 43,000KHR per day to support her family. 
This is the first loan for Sreymom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying gasoline for water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 30 years old and married with two children. 

Juvy is in the agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Juvy has been farming bananas for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juvy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adylbek

texts.en:
Adylbek is a first-year student at AUCA, department of International and Business Law. Here is his story:

“AUCA is one of the most famous universities in Central Asia. It provides financial aid for those who aspire to get proper education in many fields. There are lots of advantages why one has chosen to study at this university. The main thing that appeals to me is the study of laws; International business and law to contribute to the development of business and law in Kyrgyzstan in the future.

If you study in this field, you can find many different jobs where you can work. During my life, I have always been interested in studying different laws and legislation. I really love watching different court cases on TV. I often defend my friends in different situations and I think I do it very well. Even if I want to create my own business, legal education will help me do so.

Also, I have chosen this program because I think that a lawyer is an interesting professional. There are many different legal situations in our lives, and a lawyer can contribute to their solution and help other people.

And the final thing that attracts me is that students and professors have very friendly and close relationships, which makes the studying process itself easier and more pleasant. AUCA gives another unique opportunity to its students, which is loan. The loan is given to all students applying for financial aid, which is given by Kiva. I am very happy that AUCA cooperates with such a great organization that gives us - students - such an opportunity.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a poultry farmer who works six days a week and ten hours per day. He started the poultry business in the year 2002, and is still doing it to date. He started the business with the purpose of having a clear source of income. His business is located in Kyamabare-Kiyanga-Bumbeire in Igara County. He also has a small car, which is used as a taxi on the road, and this increases his income in a given period.

He would like to use the money to buy feeds for his chicks so that they grow and be healthy so that they can attract more customers. His clients are the local people who have supported him, since they assure him a market. However, despite the ready market, Moses has a challenge of competition and lack of finances, which is the reason why he asked for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX, so that he can buy more chicks to boost his business and get more profits from it, thereby be in position to sufficiently provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en: Loy is a mother of four, aged thirty-nine and a strong lady in business, dealing in stationery. She started dealing in stationery in 2004 and she decided to do the business because she had an urgent need of getting a source of income. Her business is located in a town cell in Ruhinda in the Mitooma District. Loy’s clients are mainly schools in the neighborhood and some individuals who buy stationery items for their personal use. She would like to use the loan money (two million shillings) to buy and stock more stationery items so that she can meet demand of her customers. Despite the challenge of competition which affects her, she hopes to be financially stable in the near future since she hopes to put the Kiva funds through UGAFODE to proper use.

loans.use: To buy reams of paper

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is married with six children and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She manages a plot of vegetable garden, while her husband does fishing to earn a living. She sells her farm products in the market, earning well that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully.

Being a member of GDMPC, she was equipped and educated on how to handle and augment her living. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to improve her farm and plant a new variety of seedlings in her additional plot of garden. In the future, Emelinda wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant a new variety of seedlings .

loans.name: Kaburisoke Ii Tukore Farmers Group

texts.en:
Erick is a 34-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a clinic, and its his main source of income. He also practices farming where he grows maize, beans, Irish potatoes, sugarcane, and bananas.

It is from this business that he has been able to sustain his family and educate his children. High license fees reduce his profit projections, while his dream is to own a big pharmacy in Kamwenge. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

Erick is requesting a loan to buy drugs to resell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to resell.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 59 years old and married with six children. Anselma works very hard to provide for them.

Anselma runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, and other groceries to sell.

Anselma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cooking oil and other groceries. 

Anselma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, and other groceries to resell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elsie is 39 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Elsie has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional bicycles for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 52-year-old widowed mother of six children, three of whom are adults.

She is in the business of selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru. She has been running this business for thirteen years, and has applied for a seventh loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to purchase a stock of clothes for resale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to develop her plot.

In the near future, she hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for one year now.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Al-Ahd Group

texts.en:
This group of five hard-working women is called Al-Ahd. The members live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 320,000 YER from AMB. 

Faiza is a 44-year-old married woman living in a poor area in Sana'a. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials like wood, sand, and cement in order to finish building her house. She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood, sand, and cement in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 31 years old. He is married with three children. He has been a maize farmer for the past six years. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 56 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Clarita has managed a general store for thirteen years, earning a good living. She was determined in running her business and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. She has been an active member of GDMPC since 2008. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Clarita is hopeful enough of earning more profit with her additional investment. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her product offerings to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Claver

texts.en:
Clever is 30 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have one child. He has been a maize farmer for the past 12 years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ma. Betty

texts.en:
Ma. Betty is 46 years old and has nine children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Ma. Betty is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Betty has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Betty would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana, está complacida con la forma que ha sido atendida y los beneficios que tiene de un crédito, por lo que nuevamente ha decidido solicitar capital para invertir en la compra de arroz, frijoles, golosinas, aceite, y jabón. Con el préstamo anterior ella surtió el negocio, tuvo más clientes satisfechos, aumento las ventas, cancelo las deudas y sigue buscando la manera hacer crecer su negocio ya que necesita mucho de esos ingresos.
Mariana ha invertido mucho de sus ingresos en la salud de su esposo, pues se encuentra muy mal de salud, a pesar de esta dificultad ella sigue responsable cumpliendo con el pago a tiempo de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Mariana is pleased with how she has progressed under the loan, which is why once again she has decided to request capital to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, snacks and soap. With the previous loan she stocked her store, had more satisfied customers, increased her sales and eliminated debt as she continues looking for a way to grow her business because she so needs the income. Mariana has put a lot of her income toward helping her husband, who is in very poor health, but despite this challenge she continues to responsibly make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, snacks, oil and soap.

loans.name: Saidmuhriddin

texts.ru:
Этого веселого мужчину зовут Саидмухриддин. Ему 30 лет. Он со своей большой семьей живет в селе района Дж.Руми. В состав его семьи входят его мама, трое братьев, сестра и его жена. В семье зарабатывают только Саидмухриддин и двое братьев. 
   Саидмухриддин хочет открыть свой магазин продуктов питания, чтобы принести больше дохода в семейный бюджет. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Ему не хватило начального капитала, чтобы открыть магазин. На сумму от кредита он приобретет продукты питания для продажи. Саидмухриддин верит и надеется в своей удаче и в Вашей поддержки.
texts.en: This cheery gentleman's name is Saidmuhriddin.  He's 30, and lives with his own big family in a village in the J.Rumy region of Tajikistan.  His family is  ade up of his mother, 3 brothers, his sister, and his wife.  Saidmuhriddin and 2 of his brothers are the only breadwinners in the family.  He would like to  pen his own grocery store to bolster his family's finances, and is seeking a loan to help set one up and stock it with various food products.  He believes he has what it takes to be a successful business owner, and is counting on your help.

loans.use: stock up on food items and open his own grocery store.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario agradece a todos los inversionistas que le ayudaron con el crédito y se siente muy contento de ser parte de este proyecto, él continua viviendo en la ciudad de Salvación y continúa dedicándose a la venta ceviche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, cebolla, ajos, lechuga, maíz y otras cosas. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mario gives thanks to all the investors who helped him with his previous loan, and he feels very happy to be part of this project. He continues to live in the city of Salvación and to work selling ceviche [a popular raw seafood dish]. He has had the business for several years now and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. 

Mario belongs to the Las Palmeras del Manu communal bank and again he requires the loan in order to buy supplies such as lemon, onion, garlic, lettuce, corn, etc. He is grateful for the loan and values it highly, and promises to make his monthly repayments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as lemon, onion, garlic, lettuce, corn, etc.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Santos Alicia

texts.es:
Santos de 39 años,  realizo sus estudios hasta 7° grado, el motivo por el cual, no pudo seguir estudiando es porque su sus padres eran de muy escasos recursos económicos; desde entonces se dedico al trabajo domestico de su hogar; oficio que aprendió con ayuda de su madre, luego fue adquiriendo experiencia en ventas de productos cosméticos y ropa por catalogo, actividad que realiza desde entonces.

  Ella vive con su familia que esta formada por su esposo, él se dedica a la carpintería y cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años, lo que lo ha llevado a instalar un taller en su casa, son una familia muy unida, son padres de dos hijos, una niña y un niño ambos están estudiando en el centro escolar; la niña se encuentra cursando el 5°grado y  tiene  11 años, y el niño cursa el 3°grado y  tiene  9 años.
    

La señora se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y venta de ropa por catalogo, con  una experiencia de 10 años en ventas de dichos productos. Ella manifiesta que adquirió experiencia y aprendió la actividad de ventas de una amiga, que tenia un negocio de ropa en el mismo lugar, Santos le ayudaba a vender y de esa forma logro adentrarse en el negocio.

 Motivada por sus esposo y por las ganancias económicas, ademas tienen ingresos producto del taller de carpintería a lo que se dedica el esposo.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para invertirlo en productos cosméticos y ropa para la venta; ya que manifestó que quiere surtir un poco mas el negocio por estar en época de fin de año, y otra parte sera invertida en compra de herramientas de trabajo para el taller de carpintería. De esta forma obtendrán mejores ingresos y podrán mejorar su calidad de vida mediante una buena nutrición y educación para su la familia.


Las metas que como familia tienen para un futuro es, apoyar a sus hijos mediante la educación y que sean unos profesionales, y por otra parte tener un taller de carpintería equipado para facilitar y agilizar el trabajo del mismo, Mediante la ayuda de Fundación Campo otorgando un nuevo crédito, y las ganancias obtenidas tienen la visión de tener un negocio mas amplio y surtido.
texts.en: Santos is 39 years old and has a seventh-grade education. She could not continue her education because her parents were very poor. Since then she worked as a household servant, a job she learned with the help of her mother, before she acquired experience selling cosmetics and clothing via catalog and has done that ever since. She lives with her husband, who is a carpenter and has six years of experience, and they have a workshop set up in their home. They are parents of two children, a girl and a boy, who both are in school. The girls is 11 years old and in the fifth grade, and the boy is 9 and in third grade. Santos makes a living selling food and also sells clothing via catalog, and has 10 years of experience selling these products. She said she learned how to sell from a friend who had a business selling clothes. Santos helped her friend and in this way introduced herself to the business. She is motivated to earn the income to go with the money from her husband's carpentry shop. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Campo to invest in cosmetic products and clothing to sell, since she wants to stock her business more for the end of the year. And she plans to use another portion to purchase tools for her husbands workshop. In this way they will earn more income and be able to improve the family's quality of life through better nutrition and education. Their goals for the family in the future is to support their children's eduction so they become professionals, as well as to have a well-equiped carpentry workshop. Through the help of Kiva and Fundación Campo and the profits Santos will make from the loan, she will have a better-stocked store.

loans.use: to invest in cosmetics and clothing to sell because she wants to stock her business for the end of the year; and to use part to purchase tools for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Aries Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ARIES”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, costura de deportivos, confección de ropa, pastelería, venta de materiales de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias/os donde la señora Mónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió al ayudar a sus padres en su taller, posteriormente decide implementar su espacio independiente, mediante el cual podrá subvencionar sus estudios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantenerse en lo posible ya que ella está estudiando y necesita recursos económicos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
Aries Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Mónica's the president.  The various businesses of the bank members include selling fruit, making athletic clothing, a bakery, and selling cleaning supplies.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs such as Mónica.  She says it's the first time she's been a member of Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently Mónica has a tailor shop that she started to help her parents in their shop; later she decided to get her own space so she could pay for her education.

Mónica's loan is to increase her capital by buying fabric from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto; after making the clothing she'll sell it in her sales stall.
