This job allows her to earn an income to support herself to the extent possible, because she's going to school and needs the money. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the loan and health trainings.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Irene

texts.fr: Irène est une femme de 40 ans fiancé et mère 4 enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans où elle vend les vêtements pour enfants (layette). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller acheter en petite quantité les vêtements qu'elle expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment et lui cause les rupture permanentes de stocks et l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle. d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter son stock surtout avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Ceci augmentera non seulement son capital, mais aussi ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour en en partie ouvrir une boutique de vêtements et aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Irene is forty years old, a fiancé, and a mother of four children. She has been selling baby clothing in a market in her area for ten years.

Because she has little capital, she can only buy small quantities of stock to display in her stall. This causes ongoing gaps in her stock and customer dissatisfaction. 

This is why a loan is important for her business, because it will allow her to increase her stock, especially during the coming end-of-the-year festivities. This loan will not only increase her capital but also her sales and her profit margin. 

She will use the earnings that she gets from this loan to open a clothing shop and also to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of baby clothing

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Marie Jeanne une femme de 33 ans mariée. Elle est commerçante et fait  l'élevage et vente  des poulets   dans un marché de la place depuis 7 mois. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau d'où d'où l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de poussins, ainsi que la provende  ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 33 years old and married. She has been raising and selling chickens in a local market for seven months. She has a good relationship with the suppliers and also her customers, who she's acquired over time thanks to her experience in this area.

However, she constantly finds gaps in her stock because she is forced to wait until she sells all her chickens before buying new ones. This is caused by her lack of capital and creates dissatisfaction among her customers.

She would like to increase her stock of chickens and feed, which will allow her to better meet the constant demand of her customers and avoid gaps in her stock.

She will use the earnings not only to expand her business but also to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of chickens and feed

loans.name: Irodi

texts.en:
Irodi lives in the village of Akhalisopeli. He is 40 years old, married and lives with his wife, school-age son and retired father. Irodi earns a living through his agricultural business and breeds two milk cows and two calves. He also grows maize and nuts and sells the harvest seasonally. Moreover, the family owns beehives with bee colonies and sells honey at the local open market. His agricultural business is successful, but the family needs a stable monthly income. 

Irodi decided to start another business as their existing income is seasonal. His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With the received credit, Irodi will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. He will earn a daily income and cover the household expenses. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vivian is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Vivian has a general store business in the Philippines. Vivian requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, fabric conditioner, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for one year. She  would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar, fabric conditioner, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Rosalie est une femme de 54ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge vari entre 33 et 9 ans. Elle commercialise des vivres secs et frais dans un marché de la place depuis neuf ans. Cependant ,elle se trouve très souvent en rupture de stocks parce qu'elle vend certains de ses produits en gros. Mais faute de moyens, elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accroitre de jour en jour. C'est pour palier à ce problème qu'elle s'est tourner vers nous pour obtenir un crédit. Ce financement l'aidera à acheter en grande quantité des vivres frais et secs( gombo, tomates, arachide, manioc, patates etc.) Le bénéfice réalisé sera par la suite réinvesti dans l'activité en partie et le reste lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rosalie is 54 years old, married, and a mother of four children, who range from nine to 33 years old. She has been selling dry and fresh foods in a local market for nine years. 

However, she often finds gaps in her stock because she sells certain products at wholesale. And due to a lack of means, she cannot meet the needs of her customers who keep growing day by day.

To solve this problem she is seeking a loan. This financing will help her to buy a large quantity of fresh and dry foods (gumbo, tomatoes, groundnuts, manioc, potatoes, etc). 

Earnings will be reinvested in the business and also used to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh and dry food

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin. His father works as an employee in a local firm. Ahmad is still a student in his last year. He studies mechanical engineering in a local university. He is a very clever student and he would like to finish his studies and start work to help his family. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to complete his study and get his BA degree. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mbayang's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 31 membres fait parti du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 31 membres qui vivent dans le village dont le BV porte le nom et les villages environnants. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Mbanyang, debout à droite le la photo et levant la main est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 05 garçons. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu de l'embouche ovine. Elle élève des moutons qu'elle revend au bout de six (06) mois dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le BV et à une très bonne expérience das ce domaine. Elle achète 02 moutons à 30 000 F l'un. Avec le reste de l'argent, elle achète des aliments pour bétail et paie les soins vétérinaires. Elle les revend entre 40 000 et 45 000 F l'un selon le flux du marché.
Avec les bénéfices, elle subvient au bien-être de sa famille (soins médicaux, frais scolaire, nourriture etc.) Elle y puise également pour compléter dès fois le paiement de ses intérêts en cas de manquement et aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 31 members is a part of the Banc Villageois that was created on 13 December 2008. The members live in the village that the banc villageois is named after and also in surrounding villages. They all get along and form a strong group. Their principal activities include commerce and animal fattening.

Mbanyang, standing on the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 54 years old. She is married and a mother of eight children, of whom five are boys. She fattens animals for a living. She raises sheep and resells them after six months in the weekly markets. She has been in this business since she joined the banc villageois and has a lot of experience in this area.

She will buy two sheep at 30,000 francs each. With the rest of the money, she will buy feed and pay for the animals` veterinarian care.

She will resell the sheep for between 40,000 and 45,000 francs each, according to the fluctuation of the market.

With the earnings, she will support the well-being of her family (medical care, school fees, food, etc). She will also work to finish the interest payments in case of loss and increase her savings.

loans.use: to fatten animals

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 31 years old, married to Grace and together they are blessed with one child aged four years old.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for nine years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his snow pea farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand and prosper in his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, 54, is married with four children and lives in a village in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She joined GDMPC in 2012 and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for their farm. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy cattle to raise so she can earn additional income on top of what she earns from her garden. Gregoria wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old and is married to Martha who operates a grocery store. Together they are blessed with two children aged 16 and seven years old.

He has a garage business in Ndunyu Njeru which he has been running for nine years and has applied for a third loan from KADET Ltd. to buy garage facilities and also boost his wife's grocery business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to prosper in his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy garage facilities and also buy stock for his grocery.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena works hard to support her family. Maria Elena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Maria Elena requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Maria Elena has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Maria Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru: Рахат 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Рахат - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахат занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Дома имеют хорошие условия для содержания скота. Супруг Улукбек занимается перевозкой пассажиров между соседними селами, также в семье Рахат проживает мама Улукбека -пенсионерка, помогает по присмотру за детьми. Ежемесячный семейный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку швейной машинки, так как в свободное время Рахат любит шить и вышивать.
texts.en:
Rakhat is 38, married, and raising 3 children together with her husband.  She has the equivalent of a high school education with some vocational training, and raises livestock for a living, first starting 18 years ago with 6,000 som worth of animals.  Her husband, Ulukbek, works in public transit, driving passengers to and from the villages in her area.  Ulubek's mother is retired and also lives with Rakhat and her family, helping look after their children when she can.
     
Rakhat's farm is ideal for raising livestock.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has a dairy cow and 10 sheep on her farm, and her monthly income has grown to nearly 4,000 som.  To further develop her farm, she is seeking a loan of 100,000 som from Bai Tushum & Partners to buy some cows.  She hopes to use any future earnings due to the loan to continue to buy more livestock, as well as to save up money for a sewing machine, as she loves to sew and embroider in her spare time.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is an entrepreneur in Ishaka town dealing in graphics and computer services which include computer training, printing and photocopying. He works six days a week and gives the business an average of ten hours per day. Christian is married to one wife and he has three children aged five, three and one with the first two in school. 

He started the business in 2002 and he is happy the business earns him some small income per month. He is also a teacher and the monthly salary he gets boosts his monthly incomes. His business is located in an easy-to-reach busy area and this helps him to get customers from far and near. He started the business mainly because it was in line with what he started and he was convinced it would be a rewarding business. His clients are mainly government parastatals (government businesses), schools and SACCOS (savings and credit cooperatives).

He hopes to use the loan money of two million Uganda Shillings to buy a plot of land so that he can construct a house there in future. His challenges among others are the high cost of rent, high electric tariffs and the bad debtors who never pay back and these take a big portion of his profits. He is a shrewd business man who hopes to overcome the challenges highlighted especially if the loan is given.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment, a compressor, materials, stones, beading and the business rights.

loans.name: Al-Qods Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Qods, and consists of three ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Aisha is the leader of this group. She is 32 years old, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a housewife who exerts herself to raise her children to have a good life. She intends to buy home appliances. She said she has a small amount of money which she collected herself, but it is not enough to buy her household needs. 

She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine to use in her house. She hopes to build a big house and enroll her children in a private school.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to use in her house.

loans.name: Serathine

texts.en:
Serathine is age 34. She is married with two children. She would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production, in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product and generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and supports labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Cristina Del Socorro

texts.es: Cristina tiene la edad de 49 años, divorciada, con un hijo bajo su cargo se dedica a la venta de refrescos, gaseosa y ropa en su domicilio desde hace 3 años. Solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de refrescos como leche, cacao, vainilla, frambuesa, azúcar, molida, bolsas, big cola de diferentes tamaños, ropa como pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, shores, etc.
texts.en: Cristina is 49 years old, divorced, and looks after her child. She has sold soft drinks, soda, and clothes from home for 3 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy the ingredients needed to make soft drinks, such as milk, cocoa, vanilla, raspberry, sugar, powder, bags, different sizes of Big Cola; and clothing such as trousers, skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients needed to make soft drinks, such as milk, cocoa, vanilla, raspberry, sugar, powder, bags, different sizes of Big Cola; and clothing such as trousers, skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Athanase

texts.fr: Athanase est un homme de 30 ans célibataire et père d'un enfant de 4 mois. Il est artisan depuis 7 ans. c'est grace à cette activité qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Elle rapporte mais la petite de son capital l'oblige à fabriquer quelques tableaux les revendre avant d'acheter à nouveau son matériel. ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter son matériel, ses ventes ainsi que son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Athanese is a 30-year old bachelor who has a four-month old child. He has been an artisan for the past seven years, and thanks to this business he is able to provide for his family's needs. It brings in money but because his capital is small he is forced to make several pictures and sell them before buying new materials. This loan will enable him to increase the materials he buys and thus his sales and profits. The profits will be reinvested in his business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to buy metal, bronze and frames.

loans.name: Marie Paule

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 33 commerçante. Elle fait  l'élevage des porcs qu'elle revend depuis 5 ans déjà  elle fonctionne à merveille mais son capital n'est pas élévé alors, elle  est obligé à chaque fois d'attendre que le stock acheté pour élever grandisse, pour le vende avant de racheter de nouveaux porcelets d'où la rupture de stock quotidienne qui cause l'insatisfaction de sa clientèle tout le temps. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre porcelets) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie is a 33-year-old woman who raises pigs to resell. She has been doing this for five years now and it is going extremely well. However, she does not have much capital, so she is forced each time to wait for the pigs she buys to be raised and sold before she can buy new piglets. This causes a rshortage of stock, which in turn leads to her customers being dissatisfied all the time. She is asking for this loan to buy a large quantity (of piglets), which will allow her not only to satisfy her already growing customer base, but also to earn more profits. The profits from this loan will help her to increase her business (by increasing the number of her piglets) and also to provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Pierre Pascal

texts.fr: Pierre est une  homme agée de 37 ans, fiancé père d'un  enfant. Il ouvert  un petit secrétariat qu'il gère depuis 5 ans, sa clientèle devient de plus en plus nombreuse alors il sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa structure en augmentant le stock du matériel bureautique pour pouvoir la satisfaire et augmenter sa production. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront non seulement d'ajouter le petit matériel bureautique, mais aussi de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Pierre is a 37-year old man, who is engaged and father to one child. He has a small secretarial services business which he has been managing for the past five years. He is getting more and more customers and is thus requesting a loan to expand his business by increasing the stock of office equipment so that he can satisfy customer demand and increase production. The profits he makes as a result of this loan will allow him not only to add to the office equipment but also to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy office equipment.

loans.name: Eric Duclair

texts.fr: Eric est un homme de 31 ans fiancé et père 3 enfants. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un gros ballot mixte. Ceci augmentera non seulement son capital, mais aussi ses ventes ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour en en partie ouvrir une boutique de vêtements et aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Eric is a 31-year old man who is engaged and father to three children. He has been a trader in a local market for the past three years and sells second-hand clothing for young people, men and women (according to the season and the bundles of clothes available). Because he does not have much capital he is forced to go to jumble sales every weekend and buy clothing on a retail basis, which he then displays on his stall. This does not really earn him much money so it is important for him to get a loan for his business so he is able to get a large bundle of mixed clothing. The loan will not only increase his capital, but also his sales and profit margin. He will save the profit he makes as a result of the loan, partly to open a clothes shop but also to provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a large bundles of mixed clothing.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une femme de 37 ans , marièe et mére de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 16 et 12 ans. Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 2 ans oû elle tient un bar. son acceil chaleureux, ses bonnes relations entretenuent avec son voisinage lui ont valu en tré peu de temps une tré grande clientéle qu' elle n'arrive plus à fidéliser à cause de la pétitesse de son capita.c' est pour cela qu'elle sollicite donc ce credit pour augmenter son stock ( acheter la biére , le vin). elle espre ainsi pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et ainsi pouvoir agrandir sa structure et réinvestire le reste pour les besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Bernadette is a 37-year-old woman, who is married and mother to three children, whose ages vary between 12 and 16 years old. She has been running a bar in one of the capital city’s neighborhoods for the past two years. Her warm welcome to customers and her good relations with her neighbors have very quickly earned her a very large customer base, but she cannot retain it because of the lack of capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock through the purchase of beer and wine. She hopes to increase her profit margin so that she can expand her business and  reinvest the remainder to meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock by purchasing beer and wine.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen, 63, lives with her husband and seven children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Hen and her husband earn a living as farmers ; they have been farming rice for thirty years, earning about 75,000KHR per day to spend for family’s needs.

Hen has been with VisionFund for seven cycles while her co-group member has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She completely paid back the past loans with VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. 

Hen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio está en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres Urbanas, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 18 Señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir están con ingresos muy bajos, pero deben seguir luchando por mejorar.
Dominga es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde joven ha trabajo y luchado, es muy luchadora y comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, y que gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de su familia en lo que hace le está yendo muy bien.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas variadas, ya que se acerca el verano y quiere poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de prendas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer.
texts.en:
The group called "San Antonio" is in its third loan cycle with the Urban Women's Committee Program. All of them promise to work and help one another so that they can move forward. The members have taken a poverty elimination survey, which indicated that two of the eighteen women are below the poverty line. In other words, they have very low income yet they continue to strive improving.

Dominga is an industrious person who has worked and strived from a very young age. She says that she sells clothing of all types. Thanks to her efforts and the support of her family, she has done very well. Dominga is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of clothes. Summer is approaching and she wants to offer her customers a wide variety of clothing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has received to grow.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a woman of fifty-seven years old, she is a widow with two children. She is a dairy farmer in Kimende on the outskirts of Limuru. Grace has been in this business for thirteen years and gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Grace's fifth loan with KADET Ltd. she plans to use the entire loan to buy animal feeds for her dairy. She wants to educate her children in future and own more cattle.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Dadeyva Pamela

texts.es: La   señora Dadeyva tiene 26 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposo con el que tiene un hijo de ocho años de edad el mismo estudia en una unidad educativa cerca al barrio para poder ahorrar en pasajes, trabaja en calidad de funcionaria en el departamento de ventas en ediciones SABER ES PODER  con una antigüedad de más de  cuatro años y también percibe otros  ingresos  provenientes del alquiler de vivienda. Solicita un crédito para la refacción de su vivienda con objeto de dejarla en buenas condiciones y alquilarla a un costo más elevado para que así pueda incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Dadeyva is 26 years old. She and her husband live at the house of her in-laws. They have an eight-year-old son who attends a school that is near their neighborhood, so they are able to save on transportation costs. Dadeyva's work involves performing quality control in the sales department of a publication called "Saber Es Poder" (Knowledge Is Power). She has four years of experience, but she also receives additional income by renting out a house.

Dadeyva is requesting a loan so that she can repair this house with the intent of keeping it in good condition. As a result, she can charge a higher rent, which will help to increase her income.

loans.use: to repair a rental house.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: Eulogia nació en la ciudad de Calca pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), ella tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde cosecha coca, yuca, plátanos, piña y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.  Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Eulogia was born in the city of Calca but lives in Salvación.  (Salvación is in the Manu district of the Manu province.  This is in the Madre de Dios department of Peru).  Eulogia is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  She is hard-working, enterprising, and is helping her family to get ahead.  Eulogia works in farming and has various plots of land where she grows coca plants, yucca, bananas, pineapple, and other things.  Eulogia has been working with this business for a number of years and it is going well thanks to her determination.  Eulogia is part of the "Las Palmeras del Manu" communal bank and, on this occasion, needs a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilisers.  Eulogia is grateful for and values this loan; she promises to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Ana Sivis

texts.es:
Ana Sivis de 33 años es maestra de educación primaria la cual desempeña su profesión en una escuela de la comunidad, ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos los 2 mayores estudian en primaria y el más pequeño en casa. Junto a su esposo trabaja la agricultura en la siembra y cultivo de café lo cual aprendió de su esposo desde hace un tiempo. Sus cultivos de café son administrados por ella mientras su esposo se encarga del mantenimiento y asistencia de la tierra y grano siendo esta su segunda cosecha. La tierra que cultivan es propia gracias al esfuerzo que juntos han hecho para evitar trabajar para otras personas lo cual han sabido valorar y apreciar ya que es el patrimonio que ayudara a sus hijos en su ausencia en un futuro. 
Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder comprar un vehículo y poder trasladarse hasta donde están ubicados ya que mismo les servirá para trasladar los insumos que compran y el grano al final de casa cosecha hasta los establecimiento que adquieren su producto ya que en este momento se transportan en motocicleta. El sueño de toda madre de familia es primeramente la salud de sus hijos y la prioridad es su educación ya que ese es el mejor patrimonio que ella considera puede dejarles. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los cuales asistirán sus cultivos de café y podrá tener una segunda cosecha exitosa la cual es necesaria para poder generar ingresos y cuidar del futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana Sivis is 33 years old and a primary school teacher, working in one of the local schools.  Ana is married and a mother to three children.  The two oldest are in primary school while the youngest still stays at home.  With her husband, Ana works in farming, sowing and growing coffee.  Ana learned this trade from her husband some time ago.  Ana manages the business while her husband is responsible for maintaining and looking after the land and the crops.  This will be the couple's second harvest.  Ana and her husband own the land they work, thanks to the efforts that they both put in so that they could avoid working for other people.  They value and appreciate their land as, in the future, when they are gone, they can leave it to their children.  

In the future, the couple wants to buy a vehicle so as to be able to travel to the land.  The vehicle would help the couple to transport supplies to the land and deliver their crops to buyers at the end of the harvest.  Currently they transport these goods on a motorcycle.

Every mother's dream is, first, for her children to be in good health.  Ana's priority is her children's education as she believes that this is the best inheritance that she can leave her children.  Today Ana is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies, which will be used to support the couple's coffee crops and to help produce a second, successful harvest.  This harvest is necessary in order to earn an income and take care of the children's futures.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Sandra tiene 46 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Casada y madre de 2 hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la costura y confección. Inicio este negocio hace varios años como trabajadora de un taller de costura, tiempo después ahorro para independizarse y tener su propio negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con su propia máquina de coser, lo que le ha permitido salir a delante. Su meta próxima es comprar más máquinas para emplear personal y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes. Solicita el crédito  para comprar: telas al por mayor, accesorios, hilos entre otros, con el fin de incrementar la producción de vestidos. Estima que el crédito le será de ayuda a suplir con la demanda de los clientes e incrementar su negocio. Su plan futuro es vender a otras ciudades del país para crecer altamente en su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sandra is 46 years old and originally from the city of Granada.  Married, and a mother to two - now independent - children, Sandra is a businesswoman; she makes a living in dressmaking.  She started this business a few years ago when she worked in a dressmaking workshop.  She spent time saving up and then became an independent businesswoman, opening up her own workshop.  Sandra now has her own sewing machine, allowing her to prosper.  Her next goal is to buy more machines in order to employ staff and to fulfil all her customers' orders.  Sandra is applying for a loan in order to buy material in bulk, plus accessories, threads, and more.  With this she can increase her production of dresses. Sandra thinks that the loan will help her to fulfil customer demand and expand her business.  Sandra's plan for the future is to sell her products in other cities around the country so that she can really expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material in bulk, plus accessories, threads, and more.

loans.name: Virgen De Yauca Group

texts.es: La Sra. Gloria   de 43 años de edad soltera y madre de  2 hijos, ella se dedica hace 10 años  a la venta de tubérculos (papa, camote, zanahoria, cebolla etc.) en un mercado alquilado,  La Sra. Gloria  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus tubérculos  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar mas tubérculos  así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Gloria   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. A la Sra. Gloria se le distingue por su chompa color mostaza es la primera de la mano derecha,  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Gloria is 43 years old and is a single mother of two children.  She has worked for the past ten years selling tubers (including potatoes, sweet potatoes, carrots, onions, etc.) in a rented market stall.  Gloria has loyal customers, which has provided income in order to cover her household expenses.  In the future she would like to have her own stall in order to be able to sell her tubers and obtain better income.  With the loan that she receives she will invest in purchasing more tubers and thus be able to get ahead.  Gloria and all of the group members in her team are thankful to Kiva and Kiva partner Edaprospo for the loan offered and for the trust that has been placed in them.  Gloria can be seen in the picture in a mustard colored sweatshirt, and she is the first person on the right hand side.  She promises to meet all of the proposed goals.

loans.use: To purchase tubers.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en Taulabe, Comayagua. anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y hace 10 años decidió  dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de batidos de dulce de caña de azúcar, alborotos (palomitas de maíz en miel),Alcitrones(ayote en miel). Este producto lo elabora y lo vende en bolsa. Ha sido cliente por varios ciclos de prestamos en ODEF, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras para invertir en su negocio en la compra de alcitrones, alporas, panelas de dulce y bolsas para preparar el producto para la venta. Su plan es lograr tener siempre el negocio para el sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en: Ramiro is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with his wife with whom he has two children and lives in Taulabe, Comayagua. He previously worked in agriculture, and 10 years ago he decided to start making and selling sweet smoothies, alborotos (popcorn in honey) and alcitrones (squash in honey). He makes and sells this product in packs. He has been a customer for several cycles of loans through the ODEF. He is currently seeking another loan of 7,000 Lempiras to invest in his business in order to buy squash, popcorn, brown sugar and packaging to prepare the product for sale. His plan is to develop the business in order to help support his family.

loans.use: to buy squash, popcorn, brown sugar and packaging to prepare the product for sale

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.en:
Abdumajid is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. 

He has worked hard since childhood. His father worked in animal husbandry, and he learned his father’s business. 

Nowadays, Abdumajid manages the business on his own and he is successful. He fattens cows as well as sheep. He wants to increase his working capital and, in this way, maximize his profit. 

He is asking for a loan to buy cattle and he awaits your support. Because he lives in a rural area, his only source of income is from animal husbandry. 

He needs to your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Gbotima Group

texts.en:
Moses is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Moses was born in Bonthe town 45 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Moses is a radio/cassette tape player repairer and has been doing this trade for the past 25 years now. This is the first loan that Moses and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Moses will use his share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy working tools and radio/cassette players' spare parts to aid him in his daily professional work.

loans.use: to buy working tools, radio/cassette players spare parts, to aid him in his daily professional work.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, in the department of International and Business Law. Here is her story.

“Studying at a university is an important period of life for a person. It is a new stage of one's life. It opens new ways to future success for you and teaches you how to survive in this world. Therefore, it's so important to choose the right university. 

"I chose the American University of Central Asia because I think it's the most high-quality university in the whole of Kyrgyzstan. First, the American studying system is different from the Asian system. I'm sure lessons by foreign professors will help me to broaden my outlook. I will be able to think wider than I do now and I would like to advance my knowledge. 

"The second reason is the English language. At AUCA, I will have to practise on a daily basis because I will be surrounded by English-speaking people. I will be able to advance to the highest level and then I will be able to travel around the world without any problems with language skills. 

"Finally, the most important reason is that I will become a high-quality specialist. The American University of Central Asia gives its students high-quality knowledge. Graduates of the AUCA are demanded everywhere in our country as good specialists. Many employers of different companies in Kyrgyzstan value graduates of this university.

"Among all the above-mentioned opportunities, AUCA gives Kiva loans to students. I would like to take the opportunity to apply for a loan that could help me to partially cover my tuition fees. It is a great chance for those students whose families are not able to cover their tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 36 years old and married to Hannah. Together, they are blessed with two children, aged 10 and two years old.

Elijah is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has been running his business for six years. 

He has applied for his first loan with the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. This loan will enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer. With his anticipated profit, he plans to buy a cow.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokun is aged 33 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working as paid workers. They have been engaging in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR to support the family. 

Sokun is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Sokun is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops and sell for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 29 years old and from Olkalou. He is married and is blessed with three children, age five years, three years and one month old.

He is a dairy farmer, a business he has been running for the last seven years. To enable him to buy another dairy cow for increased milk production and sales, he has applied for his third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD.

His monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and his plan is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children, pay back his loan to KADET LTD and to buy some more dairy cows. His hopes and dreams for his future business are to be an established dairy farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for increased milk production and sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin city called Qabatia. He works in a local factory for stones. It is a good job and he gets a good income. Ahmad had a work accident that injured his hand bones. He must have surgery so he can go back to work.

He requested a USD $1,000 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital costs for doing surgery on his hands. By applying for this loan, he will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses he has. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital costs for doing surgery on his hands.

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is a 52-year-old married man who lives in the village of Leghva with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and retired mother. Zaur runs a small dairy farm with one milk cow and one calf.  He also grows citrus fruits and walnuts on the family-owned land. 

Zaur works hard all day long to earn his living, but his existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses. That is why Zaur has decided to start another business. 

He applied for credit from MFO Credo, and his request was approved under the startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $4,000 will help Zaur to purchase a minibus. Zaur will work on the minibus line as a driver and transport passengers from his district to the capital city. 

This new business initiative will significantly increase the family's funds. With the increased income, the family will be able to increase their daily spending and improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and start working on the minibus line

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
Nim, 44, is married with four children residing in a rural village located in the Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district in Cambodia. For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. She can earn around 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Nim’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and she has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles already. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Nim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a higher crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail business for twelve years, working in his village and doing farming as an additional income source. Alfred started in business to improve his family's life style, whereby he is able to buy all their basic needs.

His dream is to transform his business into a mini-supermarket and move into a busy place in town. His income is affected by price fluctuations and seasonal changes. Alfred intends to use the loan to buy soap and juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and juice to sell.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is age 38 and married. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on the family, and they are now still in school. Living in a village of the Ou Dung district, Kunthea has been farming rice and selling snacks for almost 20 years. She manages to earn about US$16 per day to feed her family. 

Kunthea is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is asking for an education loan to pay her son’s university fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in the university until graduation and also that it will help to relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university fees.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Money Finders Group

texts.en:
Baby is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Lunsar town 35 years ago. She is married to a motor mechanic and the couple has 4 children, 2 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Baby sells palm oil (the country's most popular cooking oil) and has been running this business for 6 years now. 

With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Baby will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to buy a large quantity of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella arrived in the United States from the Bahamas 27 years ago, determined to create and build something on her own. It wasn’t until 2007, after 18 years of studying fashion and working in the fashion industry, that Marcella stumbled upon a bright idea.

She noticed that existing Christian-based clothing lines neglected to offer their designs in a wide range of languages. Mishenere (pronounced “missionary”, Marcella’s clothing line, offers a resolution to this void in the fashion industry. Marcella creates inspirational T-shirts, available in a variety of different languages, that spread the message of hope. Her shirts are a hit. Earlier this year, she debuted some new designs at a local conference in Miami, Florida and earned tons of praise and new clientele.

Now, with your help, Marcella can take Mishenere to the next level. With this loan, Marcella can begin developing a professional e-commerce website, purchase new equipment to make her shirts, and purchase office equipment so that she can manage sales and track inventory. 

Help Marcella build her website and put Mishenere on the online fashion map.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment to make shirts and to purchase accounting equipment.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is 23 years old. She is an entrepreneur who is divorced and has no children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 3 years. Little by little with the passing of time she has perfected her knowledge. Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large number of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market.

Sayora is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 26 years old. She is married with one child. She owns a grocery boutique and has been running a business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and bananas for sale

loans.name: Victor Jose Luis

texts.es:
Victor  es un joven de 23 años el cual trabaja como obrero agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad, trabaja con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Victor está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como triplay, maderas, entre otros, de esta manera podrá realizar mejoras en la casa donde vive y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Victor is 23, lives in Imperial, and works as a farm laborer there to earn income so that he can achieve a better life. He works nine hours a day and believes that his job is going well because he's a very dependable worker.  

Victor is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help, which will allow him to purchase construction materials such as Triplay, wood, and other items. Victor will use these materials to make improvements to his home so that he can achieve a better quality of life and pursue his great ambition: professional study at a university.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Doña Odilia, tiene 63 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su  esposo, reside en Taulabe, Comayagua junto a un hijo y su esposo. Siempre se a dedicado a la agricultura. Ella cultiva café y granos básicos. El café lo vende en pergamino a los intermediarios de la zona. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener el negocio, el que solicita actualmente es por 2,500 Lempiras  para limpieza y compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a los cultivos. Ella quiere mantener siempre sus cultivos para la manutención  familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Odilia is 63 and lives with her husband and their son in Taulabe, Comayagua. Doña Odilia has always farmed for a living and grows coffee and staple grains. She sells coffee cherries to wholesalers in the Taulabe area. 

Doña Odilia has received several loans to sustain her business, and is now applying for a loan of 2,500 Lempiras for cleaning and purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizers for crop maintenance. Doña Odilia wants to continue to growing crops to support her family.

loans.use: for cleaning and to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a business lady in Kizinda trading center in Ishaka town, where she has a shop for garments. She is age forty-two years and still determined to carry on the business from one level to another with the main purpose of earning enough money to look after her family. 

In addition to trading in garments, she also has a retail shop which boosts her income greatly. Amina started the business in 1995 and she is proud that the small profits gotten from the business are sustaining her family. 

The reason why she is borrowing two million shillings is so that she can restock the shop and get higher profits, and also to be able to provide better things for her family. Her customers are mainly women from the same locality. 

Amina believes that the sales will be high, since it is approaching the festive season. Inadequate capital is her main challenge but she is hopeful that it will cease to be a challenge if she gets the loan, since she will restock the shop with new clothes, make higher sales and get more profits that will be plowed back into the business. As a result, the challenge will be no more.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is twenty-four years old and a businessman in a trading center where he has a retail shop. He started the business in 2011 and he has carried it on to date. He started the business with an aim of making money that he would use to fulfill the needs of his family. 

In addition to the retail shop, he also offers mobile money services where he gets a commission, which boosts his income. His clients are the people in the Kizinda trading center where his business is located. 

Felix hopes to use the loan money of two million shillings to buy more stock items so that he can meet the demands of his customers in the festive season of December. His major challenge is the lack of enough capital, but he hopes to overcome this if the Kiva funds through UGAFODE are given, because he will buy enough stock and will then have a competitive edge.

With his hard work, Felix is determined to achieve his goal of having and operating a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married mother of five children, all of whom go to school. They live at their own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan,  she wants to purchase three stocks of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three stocks of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 38 years old. She is married with five children. She has been selling sugar and cooking oil for the past five years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca agradece a los inversionistas que leyeron su historia y que les haya gusto mucho pues se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea continuar participando en el proyecto, ella continua viviendo en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella continua con la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella sigue siendo una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia pues ella pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi”, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Francisca is grateful to the lenders who read her profile and liked it. She is happy to have received their support and wants to continue participating in the microfinance project. 

Francisca still lives in Pilcopata and continues to make a living buying and selling lumber. She has run this business for several years and it's going well thanks to her diligent efforts. Francisca has always been a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who provides for her family. She belongs to the Paititi communal bank, and is now applying for a loan to purchase wood. Francisca is determined to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Percy Edinson

texts.es:
Percy tiene 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder tener ingresos para salir adelante trabaja como obrero agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad, el labora alrededor de 9 horas y cree que le va bien porque es muy cuidadoso.

Percy está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar adobe para poder realizar el cercado de la vivienda donde habita y de esta manera tener más seguridad, así poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Percy is 19 and lives in the city of Imperial. He works as a laborer at a farm in Imperial to earn income, working about nine hours day. Percy believes his job is going well as he's a very conscientious worker. 

Percy is very grateful to Kiva lenders as their help will allow him to purchase adobe and build a fence around his home. This fence will provide greater 
security and allow Percy to pursue his great ambition: professional studies at a university.

loans.use: to purchase adobe.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Oliva is age 21. She is single and has been selling juice and tea for one year. With the loan, she wants to buy more andazi (doughnuts) and more African tea to sell in her tea shop. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more African tea and andazi (doughnuts) to sell in her cafe.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 55 years old. She is married with five children aged 17 to 30, and they all go to school. She sells foodstuffs. She has the need of adding new items such as cooking oil and sugar, and she has requested this loan to buy the mentioned items to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings for the purpose of a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 35 years old and lives in a suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi, with his wife and school age son. Aleksandre’s economic activity is a car import business. Specifically, he works on special projects, goes abroad and transports cars for selling. His business is lucrative but time-consuming. He spends most of his time abroad and his family members are alone at home. That is why Aleksandre decided to start a business in his home town and spend his free time with his family. 

He owns a car and is now requesting a loan to change his car’s fuel system from petrol to gas, which is cheaper than petrol, and start a taxi business. This will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent and Aleksandre will generate good income. It will allow him to offer his clients low prices for service, which will attract many customers. With the received amount, he will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for his family's well being.

loans.use: to change his car's fuel system and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
From Lagodekhi district, 60-year-old Natela lives with her son, who works physically to generate the family's only income. Natela decided to start a  family business and so requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 700 gel to purchase hens and ducks whose eggs she will sell to generate income. 

 Natela will use the income to expand her business. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase hens and ducks

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, a 30-year-old married mother of four, has been running a salon for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more salon equipment such as hair beauty products, clippers and shampoos for use in her business. Clementine will reinvest the profits in her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more salon equipment

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 39 years old, a vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of four children. Her husband’s income is not enough to support his family well.

She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past four years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Shabana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Nargas

texts.en:
Nargas is a 42-year-old married woman. She has six children: five daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packets of buttons and needles. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packets of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una joven de 28 años de edad, madre de tres hijos los cuales están en la escuela de la comunidad y en compañía de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura cultivan café para la venta y generación de ingresos para su familia, maíz y frijoles para consumo. El café que ellos cultivan es catimora y lempira los cuales están en excelentes condiciones y casi listos para esta próxima temporada ya que se requiere de la compra de algunos insumos para poder asistirlos y prepararlos para la cosecha y para su venta. En familia viven muy humildemente su casa está construida de bloque sin repello, artesón de madera y techo de zinc la cual es propia y dan gracias a Dios por tener un hogar y un techo digno. Sus cultivos de café están cerca de su casa de habitación al cual en compañía de su esposo se trasladan caminando para la debida limpieza y mantenimiento de maleza.
Actualmente ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para mejorar su producción de café comprando los insumos necesarios para su mantenimiento y atención. 
Ella espera que se le apoye con su solicitud ya que es el único medio y forma de ingreso económico para su familia para que ellos puedan cumplir con sus sueños de seguir apoyando a sus hijos con la parte educacional y formar un patrimonio sólido para su futuro. De esta manera quedara satisfecha y con mucha puntualidad cumplirá con el compromiso para poder seguir gozando de los beneficios y demás servicios.
texts.en:
María is a 28 year old woman. She is the mother of three children who are in the community school. With her husband, who is a farmer, they grow coffee to sell and generate income for the family and corn and beans for consumption. The coffee that they grow is catimora and lempira, which are in excellent condition and almost ready for the next season. They require the purchase of materials to help them and to prepare for the harvest and sale. With their family they live very humbly in their house built from unplastered blocks, panels of wood and a zinc sheeting roof. They own it and thank God for having a home and worthy shelter. Their coffee crops are close to their house and with her husband she walks there to do the clearing and the weed maintenance.

Right now, she is asking for a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to improve her coffee production by buying the materials she needs for maintenance and care. She hopes that she will be helped with her request since this is the only income for her family so that they can make their dreams come true of helping the children in their education and creating solid assets for their future. This way, she will be satisfied and pay off her loan on time, with the commitment of being able to keep enjoying the benefits and other services.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 45-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She has one buffalo. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. 

She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Madhab

texts.en:
Madhab is a 44-year-old differently able person living with his wife and two children in a small village of Odisha, India. He started a motorcycle repair center 12 years ago to manage his family. Before his own repairing shop he worked in a motorcycle repairing shop as a daily labourer. 

He started his own repairing center in a very small size. Whatever he earns from this activity is used for consumption purposes and it's not sufficient for his family to live happily and afford all the necessities of life.

Now he wants to expand his business and for that he needs financial support. To repair motorcycle,s he goes very frequently to the market to purchase the spare part of the cycle. Because of lack of finance, he is not able to purchase the spare parts in bulk amounts, so he has requested a loan amount of 20,000 INR to reconstruct his shop and purchase spare parts like tyres,tubes, oil, etc.

loans.use: To pay for reconstruction of his shop and to purchase spare parts like tyres, tubes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Scovai

texts.en:
Scovia, a 30-year-old mother of four, is a farmer and also runs a retail shop. Her main challenge is climate variability.

A hardworking woman, Scovia will use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have all of her children educated.  

In the photo is Scovia with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De Magdalenas Group

texts.es:
Historia dúo Mariposas de Magdalena
Este dúo está conformado por doña Marta Julia, ella tiene 49 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, regalos, cosméticos, en su tienda llamada miscelánea Julita ubicado en Magdalena Milpas Altas, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de su tienda en especial en compra de ropa para la temporada  de frio así como regalos y zapatos, y también necesita comprar una vitrina para exponer sus productos, su deseo es seguir  mejorando su negocio y seguir surtiendo más su tienda y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, les agradese por su ayuda ya que ustedes han sido de mucho apoyo para ella y su familia ya que por medio de su negocio ella a ayudado a la superacion de su familia.
texts.en:
The Mariposas de Magdalena Duo Story

This duo was formed by Marta Julia. She is 49 and works selling clothes, shoes, gifts, and cosmetics in her variety store called Julita, located in  Magdalena Milpas Altas. She is asking for the loan to invest in her store, especially in buying seasonal cold weather clothing as well as gifts and shoes. She also needs to buy a display case to display her products. She wants to keep improving her business and keep stocking her store and offer her customers more products. She is grateful for your help, since you all have given a lot of support for her and her family, since she through her business she has helped her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, gifts, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 58 years old. She is married and has nine children. 

She owns a canteen that she has been running for the past four years. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more mineral water and African tea for sale. She is planning to use the profits to reinvest in the same business for better sustainability.

loans.use: To buy more mineral water and tea for sale.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a la ganadería, es casado, es padre de dos hijos, es quien genera los ingresos para que su familia tenga lo necesario. Desde que era un niño aprendió de su padre a estas actividades agrícolas y así como ha utilizado sus conocimientos para generar en el área para generar ingresos.
Comprará pesticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y pagara mano de obra para preparar la tierra y sembrar a tiempo, espera no enfrentar dificultades climáticas que le echen a perder su cosecha, también generar más ganancias, cancelar las deudas y tener una buena producción.
Sueña con seguir dándoles mejorando la alimentación que la a sus hijos, darles acceso a salud, y que tengan un futuro con preparación académica superior.
texts.en:
José grows basic grains and raises livestock. He is married and the father of two children. He is the one who generates the income so his family will have what they need. Since he was a child, he learned these farming activities from his father and he has used his knowledge in the area to generate income. 

He will buy pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides and will pay for labor costs to prepare the soil and plant on time. He hopes not to face weather difficulties that will cause him to lose his harvest. He also hopes to generate more earnings, pay off his debts and have a good yield. 

He dreams of being able to continue improving the food he gives his children, giving them access to health so they will have a future with higher education.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides, as well as to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, pest controllers, fertilizer, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.

She is doing a business of tailoring to contribute in the family income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons and laces, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Azra hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with packs of buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Anne Margo

texts.fr: Anne Margo est une femme âgée de 37 ans, elle est célibataire et mère de 02 enfants âgés de 17 et 14 ans. Elle détient un débit de boisson dans un quartier de la cité capitale qu'elle gère depuis bientôt trois ans. Suite au coup de vol qu'elle a connu récemment, elle ne parvient plus à satisfaire normalement ses clients. D'où la nécessité pour elle d'avoir ce crédit grâce auquel elle pourra se réapprovisionner et par la même occasion remplacer ses canapés déjà amortis. Les bénéfices qui résulteront de cette activité seront réinvestis et le reste servira à l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anne Margo is 37 years old, single, and a mother of two children, aged 17 and 14. 

She owns and has been managing a place that sells drinks in the capital city for three years. 

Following a recent robbery, she can no longer satisfy her usual customers. This is why she needs this loan, so that she can restock and also buy some [new] sofas that are due to be replaced.

The resulting earnings from this business will be reinvested and used to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. 

Currently, Naseem has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2, Eastern area, in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. She began her business because she wants to empower herself and children. For the past 10 years, Kadiatu established her retail business.  She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is having a good marketable place to sell.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase cosmetic items like purses, earrings, chains and bracelets. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like purses, earrings, chains and bracelets

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 24-year-old vigorous lady and the mother of two children. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Tajaan

texts.en:
Tajaan, age 49, deals in a business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also deals in the work of selling milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Belive In God Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Believe In God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each.
