With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

M’balu is the featured leader of this group. The 53-year-old is married to a trader and they have 2 children. M’balu has been a businesswoman for 5 years now; she sells palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and used clothes. With her share of this loan, she will buy a large quantity of palm-oil and bales of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm-oil and bales of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, and pants.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Shama is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. After her husband’s business failure, she started her business sewing clothes to contribute in the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles. With these she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en: Waseem is a 39-year-old vigorous lady; she has worked in sewing sofa covers for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. By the time she has attained regular list of customers but due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads along with the bundles of cloths in different colors. It will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads along with the bundles of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 33-year-old married woman and the loving mother of four children. Her husband works in a factory as a laborer and his income is insufficient to meet their family expenditure. That is why she started a business stitching clothes ten years ago. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of threads, laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. In 2009, Rugiatu established her retail business. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like palm oil and soap to prepare her soap business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Rugiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like palm oil and soap for her soap business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animals’ purchase and sales for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Reehana

texts.en: Reehana is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of two. She decided to work to support her family for a better future. Twelve years ago she began stitching clothes in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy spools of threads along with packs of laces and zippers in different colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads, packs of laces, and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of eight.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of palm-oil and pepper to add to her current stock

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Ahmad's family owns a small agricultural land with olive trees. They get a good income but seasonal. Ahmad has worked as a painter for two years. It is a good business and he earns a good income.

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools like a ladder and paint brushes for his work. With this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his work with better quality. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools like a ladder and paint brushes for his work

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 34-year-old woman and the mother of three children, who all go to school. She has been successfully running a small general store from the corner of her house. She has three years of experience in this field. She offers various items such as reels of thread, ribbon and cleaning products, etc. The business has great potential for growth, and Nazia is actively working as this business is the only source of income for them. 

In order to meet the demands of her customers, Nazia is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of shampoo and soap. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good credit history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of shampoo and soap

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is from the village of Akaurta. He is 26 years old, married, and lives with his parents, brother, sister-in-law and two nephews. The family runs an agricultural business and breeds ten milk cows and fifteen calves. The women from the family make cheese with the milk and sell locally. Ramil also grows wheat on the family-owned piece of land and sells the harvest seasonally. Moreover, he has a truck and works on transportation in his village. He serves the villages on special orders and gets service fee.

Ramil plans to begin trading food products to increase family income but he needs a van in order to make deliveries. With the loan, Ramil will pay for the van and start buying citrus as it is now harvest season and the prices are low. He will transport fruits from west Georgia and sell with the price mark-up in his district. He will also sell various vegetables seasonally and work hard to develop his business. Ramil is a very hardworking man with a great desire to ensure that his family members have good living conditions. He will earn a good income in order to satisfy the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use for making product deliveries.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 44-year-old married woman. For the past two years she has been selling spices which are used in cooking food for taste. She purchases spices in bulk from the wholesales market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to have a decent life. She is a responsible mother of two children and needs to earn more to bear daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. It will help her to inflate her sales. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize her earned profit on her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past four years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR [Pakistani rupees] to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Einar

texts.en: Einar is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi district with his wife, mother and two children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 4 cows and 2 calves whose milk is used in cheese products. His wife milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell. In addition, they have small agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Einar is a very hard-working young man and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. As the income is not enough to cover everyday costs, Einar decided to start his business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $5000 to begin trading cattle. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family as the income will increase.

loans.use: to begin trading cattle

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Hard Work” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each of them in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Theressa is the featured leader of this group. Theressa is 30 years old, she is married with three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Theressa sells beans, groundnuts, cassavas, etc. and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Theressa will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of beans, groundnuts, cassavas, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans, groundnuts and cassavas to add to her business.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is a 32-year-old married man from a small village called Romanah near Jenin City. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a simple house in the village. For the past four years, Amin has been working in a small store selling shoes. It is a good business, but still needs a lot of improvements. 

Amin took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to decorate his store and buy more products to sell. With this loan, Amin will be able to improve his business and also his income. Amin dreams to take a bigger loan in the future to open another store and expand his business. Amin appears in the photo in front of his store.

loans.use: to decorate his store and buy more products to sell.

loans.name: True Day Last Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “True Day Last” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Memunatu. Memunatu is aged 40; she was born in Makeni City where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a trader and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Memunatu has been selling cloths/clothes. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of cloth/clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cloth/clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man and the father of a child who is attending school. He combines forces with his wife who works as an accountant to be able to meet the living expenses. 

As for his work experience, Elie is a professional worker particularly specialized at cleaning jewelry so it ends up sparkling and gleaming so that customers can see clearly the beauty of each element. He works from his house and he is currently seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase specific machinery with which he will be able to clean more deeply his products. 

His only aim is to always provide his customers with luxury products to always keep his sales rate high and be able to earn a good income that supports well the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase specific machinery.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 49-year-old Lebanese widowed woman and the mother of three children. Throughout her life, she has faced ups and downs but the most catastrophic situation was when her husband passed away. She suffered from a really bad financial situation and did her best to overcome that period by starting to work at her house by producing handcrafts. 

And as Salma is keeping on working very hard to satisfy her children’s needs, she is asking today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase needed tools such as knitting needles, needles and sewing strings. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income. This is how she works every day to make her greatest dream become a reality: "To have a bigger business."

loans.use: to purchase needed tools such as knitting needles, needles and sewing strings.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, su hija y su padre, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su vehículo por la diferentes colonias, posee clientela establecida que lo buscan por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y la amabilidad con sus clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos de los gastos que se le presenta en su hogar, Carlos esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar llantas y repuesto para su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 34 years old and lives in a home of his own, along with his wife, daughter, and father.  He makes trips with his vehicle, through different neighborhoods and has steady customers who seek him out because he is responsible when it comes time to drive and he is friendly with his customers.  He is able to cover his household expenses with the money he earns through his work.  Carlos is asking for a loan to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle since it’s his only source of work and he wants to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 30 years old married to Loise and together they are blessed with two children aged seven and two years old.

He is in the business of selling motor cycle spare parts in Ndunyu Njeru. He has been running this business for three years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more stock for his business. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and also pay back the loan amount.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business to a large scale.

loans.use: To buy motor cycle spare parts.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 43 years old and from Olkalou. She is married to Samuel, and they are blessed with four children, aged 18, 15, 13 and 9 years old.

She is a farmer who specializes in growing wheat and food crops like potatoes, maize, beans and cabbages. It is a business she has been running for the last 15 years. To enable her to buy some fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides to use on her crops for maximum yields, she has applied for her second loan of 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] from KADET LTD.

Her monthly income right now is 9,000 KES, and she intends to use profits realized from her expanded business  to educate her children. In the future, she hopes to benefit more from her farming activities and be able to provide a good life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a man of forty two years, married to Jane and a father of four children. He has a motorcycle transportation business and also sells wool.  He has been in this business for four years now and he gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Charles' third loan with KADET LTD.  He plans to use the entire loan to buy wool for resale. He wants to educate his children and be a prosperous business man in future.

loans.use: to buy wool for resale

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 36 years old, and he lives in Stepanavan city, which is in the Lori region. He is married and he has two children. For five years, Arman has had his own business. In a rented shop, he sells animal fodder, and his customers are nearly all the farmers of nearby villages. He sells corn, barley and a lot of different types of animal fodder that villagers used to buy. Arman considers his business a very profitable one, but he thinks that he will have more income if his shop assortment is wider.

Arman asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to make his shop assortment more various, which will help him to have good sales.

loans.use: to make his animal-fodder shop assortment more various, which will help him to have good sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, soap, rice, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a liquor business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more liquor to sell and add more stock so that she can get a good profit to support her family well. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more liquor to sell and add more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide, and thread.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos está solicitando otro crédito por que necesita capital para invertirlo en la venta de comida. Comprará embutidos, carnes, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, arroz, entre otros ingredientes que necesita para variar el menú que ofrece a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior consiguió tener a más clientes satisfechos aumentar sus ingresos, ampliar el negocio, darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is requesting a loan because she needs capital to invest in her food stall.  She will buy sausage, meat, vegetables, condiments, drinks, rice, and other ingredients that she needs to vary the menu that she offers her customers.

With her previous loan, she had more satisfied clients, grew her income and business, and was able to provide her family with an improved way of life.

loans.use: to buy sausage, meat, vegetables, condiments, drinks, and rice.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
A mother in early 60 and blessed with five children, Heang is a villager from Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. The main sources of her family’s income are from one hectare of rice farming and a pig-raising business. This is the first microloan for Heang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Heang wants to help her grandson to achieve his dream of become a doctor. Hence, she is applying for an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her grandson. She hopes that her grandson can get a good job with a proper income to support himself as well as the family.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her grandson.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Hawanatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and her children. In 2007, Hawanatu established her general stock business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a good marketable place to sell.

Hawanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cream, perfume and nail polish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. In the future, Hawanatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cream, perfume and nail polish for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, a 27-year-old from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  For the past 13 years, Aminata has established her retail business. She began her business because she wants generates a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because she makes profit.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coconut oil to expand her business

loans.name: Jessica Pastora

texts.es: Jessica, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada y vendía mercadería por pedidos. Hace 8 años que estableció un  negocio de un salón de belleza donde ofrece servicios de aplicación de tintes, corte de cabello, alisado chino, tratamientos para el cabello, uñas acrílica, manicure y pedicure etc.  El negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado local. Ha invertido varios préstamos en el negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 12,000 lempiras  y lo va invertir en la compra de  productos para belleza como ser tintes, esmaltes, limas, cremas, champú y tratamientos para el cabello. Ella espera mejorar su inventario de insumos que utiliza en su salón. Tiene como meta comprar una casa y también para poner otro salón de belleza en un futuro.
texts.en: Jessica is 33 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She used to work for a private company, selling merchandise to order, but she set up his own business, a beauty salon eight years ago, where she offers services such as tints, cuts, perms, hair treatments, acrylic nails, manicures and pedicures.  Her business is located at a local market and she has invested into her business with the help of several loans.  She is requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 Lempiras so she can buy beauty products such as tints, nail polish, emery boards, creams, shampoos, and hair treatments.  She is hoping to improve the inventory of supplies in her salon.  Her goal is to buy a house and open a second salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatma

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatma is 45 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has seven children for a total of nine members in her home. It was very tough for her to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. 

For this purpose she started her business selling cloth where she buys cloths of different varities from the wholesale market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history,

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Maryam has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Maryam is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena, age 30, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, age 28, is a married woman and the mother of three. She has been selling milk with her husband for many years.  She has three cows which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality.

Kousar needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health. In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more cow to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 63 años de edad se dedica  a la crianza de ganado de doble propósito (producción de leche y ganado de engorde) desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Oscar está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así el podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Oscar is 63 years old and has been raising livestock with a dual purpose (milk production and fattening up) for various years.  He is able to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns.  Oscar is asking for a loan to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for his livestock, since this is his only source of work.  In this way he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life without limits.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of salted fish, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Estela

texts.es: Sandra vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de 24 años de edad, ella se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es una mujer emprendedor, dedicada  a su labor, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en: Sandra lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and 24 year old daughter.  She works her mill and processes all types of food, such as corn, beans, flours, salsas, and other things.  She has had this business for some time and has lots of experience that helps her have good earnings.  She is well known by the local people and has many customers who prefer to buy from her because of the quality products, good prices, and unequalled service.  She is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and her customer demand has increased in the recent weeks, but her two mills can no longer keep up.  She is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy a new mill.  She has good credit references, is responsible, and promises to repay the debt.  She also has faith that she will bring financial and emotional stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks.

loans.name: Micaela Bastida Ii Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 9  personas emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “Micaela Bastida II”.  La Sra. demesia  de 53 años de edad casada  y madre de  5 hijos, ella se dedica hace 7 años  a la venta de comida tanto en le día como en la noche r.  La Sra. Demesia     ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en  ampliar su local   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Demesia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  ,  A la sra. demesia se le distingue con su chompa de color verde, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en:
This communal group, "Micaela Bastida II" is made up of nine enterprising people who bring a lot of creativity to their businesses.  The featured borrower is Demesia.  She is fifty-three years old, is married, and has five children.  She has been making a living selling food during both the day and night for seven years.  Demesia has built up a loyal customer base, allowing her to generate better profits in order to cover home expenses.  

In the future, she would like to have her own stall where she could sell her foods and obtain even better economic profits.  With the requested loan, she will invest in founding her business premises, which will allow her to move herself ahead. 

Demesia and all the group members are grateful to Kiva.  In the photo, Demesia is in the green sweater.  She would like to close her message in saying that she will keep her promise to work towards all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to enlarge her business premises.

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorrro

texts.es: Doña Feliciana a su edad es una señora muy trabajadora, en la actualidad vende  fritanga por las noches y un poco de ropa variada en el día, ubicada en su casa de habitación, trabaja junto a su esposo quien es jubilado, ambos se apoyan para salir adelante. Doña Feliciana solicita el crédito para poder aumentar el número de platos de comida al día, más ahora que se acercan las festividades de fin de año en donde desea aprovechar para aumentar sus ingresos economicos, con el préstamo comprara granos básicos, aceite, carnes, verduras, frutas.
texts.en: Feliciana, at her age, is a very hardworking woman who sells fried foods in the evenings, and a bit of clothing during the day.  She works out of her home alongside her husband who is retired and they help one another get ahead.  Feliciana is asking for this loan to be able to increase the number of dishes she can produce each day, especially now that the end of year festivals are approaching and she wants to take advantage of this to increase her income.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, meats, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Taypi Marka * 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento TAYPI MARKA * 26,  está compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco  mujeres y tres varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Yolanda, tiene 46 años y es casada,  ella se dedica al bordado de artesanías, se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo aprendió esta actividad de sus padres que también eran artesanos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de telas e hilos para el bordado de sus artesanías, la señora Yolanda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que el trabajo es un poco moroso por realizarlo manualmente,  Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su trabajo, su deseo para su negocio es  ampliar la venta poniendo una tienda donde pueda exponer su trabajo ya que ahora solo lo realiza a pedido y entrega a distintos lugares donde le hacen pedidos  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The TAYPI MARKA *26 entrepreneurial bank is made up eight members, five women and three men, all with different businesses.  Yolanda is the bank’s president.  She is 46 years old, married, and has been doing embroidery for some time.  She learned this activity from her parents who were also artists.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy fabric and thread.  Yolanda faces challenges in that the work is a bit tedious to do by hand.  She will use the benefits to continue improving her work and her goal is to set up a store where she can work strictly on order and then deliver to her customers.  In this way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Señora Rosmery sigue con la misma actividad entretenimiento con su discoteca donde le va muy bien,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra mesas y sillas para su negocio, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de equipos para así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos se siente feliz y agradecida con Kiva por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Rosemery continues to run a disco, and things are going very well for her.  She says that things went very well with the previous loan and she used the money to buy tables and chairs for her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy equipment so she can continue improving her business and income.  She is happy and grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Musulmon

texts.ru: Мусулмон является одним из активных студентов Медицинского колледжа. Он учится на 3 курсе по специальности дантиста. Мусулмон с детства мечтал стать медиком и после окончания средней школы с помощью своих родителей он поступил в Медицинский колледж. Он считает, что выбрал хорошею профессию, так как лечить больных это самое благотворительное дело. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но в этом году его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Musulmon is a third-year student specializing in dentistry and one of the most active students in his medical school. He has dreamed of becoming a doctor since childhood and after finishing high school, with the help of his parents, he enrolled in medical school. He believes he has chosen a worthwhile profession, since treating the sick is the most charitable of actions. 

Musulmon needs to pay for his education costs, but this year his parents are unable to cover the costs. He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a thirty-nine-year-old woman. She is married to Peter and together they have three children. She owns a farm in Kimende in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in this business for thirteen years now; she gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Susan's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. She wants to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
Spès  fait partie du groupe  Amahoriwacu  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 41ans et est mariée à P. Claver. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 18 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de banane  et de  poissons (ndagala)  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle  est son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Spès is part of the group Amahoriwacu and lives in Gitega. She is 41 years old and married to P. Claver. Together they have five children, from 5 to 18 years old, of whom four are students. 

Spès has been doing commerce in bananas and fish (ndagala) for three years. 

She is on her second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Eten, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día como cajera en una pequeña tienda de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante; Doris cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrada.

Doris esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda, asi como también podrá comprar una cama ya que actualmente duerme en una hecha de palos de eucalipto, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un restaurante y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Doris is a 29 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Eten. She works about 9 hours a day as a cashier in a small store in her city, which gives her enough income to get ahead. Doris feels that things are going well for her due to her responsibility and honesty.

Doris is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to this loan she can buy household goods for her home and also buy a bed. Right now she sleeps in a bed made from eucalyptus branches. In this way she can improve her quality of living and continue to struggle towards her big dream which is to study at university.

loans.use: to buy household goods and a bed.

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Patrice  fait partie du groupe  Kwizera  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 60 ans et est marié à Rose. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants  âgés de 18 à  22 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce  d’habits depuis 3 ans. 

Il  est son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle, construire une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Patrice is part of the group Kwizera and lives in Bujumbura. He is 60 years old and married to Rose. Together they have three children from 18 to 22 years old, of whom two are students. 

Patrice has been doing commerce in clothing for three years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land, build a nice house, and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Rene Jonaz

texts.es:
Rene de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy esforzada y líder de la comunidad, estudio hasta 9° en la comunidad, el bachillerato no lo pudo  realizar por que había que viajar hasta otro lugar y las condiciones económicas no le permitieron continuar,; es por eso,  que se dedica a trabajar  la agricultura al lado de su padre, desde muy corta edad, lo ha realizado. Él vive aún con sus padres y 2 sobrinos y sus hermanos  están fuera del país y  han dejado  a su cargo el cuidado de los niños  y también de sus  padres.

El trabajo agrícola lo realiza desde muy corta edad, eso le permite contar con una gran experiencia, para cultivar la tierra año con año. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para la construcción del piso de su casa, ya que es de tierra y en el invierno la situación se vuelve complicada, los materiales a utilizar son: 8 bolsas de cemento, 2 mt de arena, 60 ladrillos de obra para levantar 30 centímetros del suelo y que no entre la tierra a lo reparado. 

En el futuro desea realizar sus estudios pendientes, para tener una opción de incorporarse al mundo  laboral y así darle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rene is 27 years old and is a very determined person and community leader.  He has a ninth grade education and he was not able to work toward a bachelor’s degree because he would have needed to travel to another area and financial conditions did not permit him to continue.  For this reason he decided to work in farming alongside his father from a young age.  He lives with his parents and two nephews.  His brothers are outside the country and have left their children and parents in his charge.

He has been farming from a young age, which has provided him with lots of experience in cultivating the land year after year.

He will the money from this loan to install a floor in his house, as the current one is a dirt floor and that makes the winters difficult.  He will use 8 bags of cement, 2 meters of sand, and 60 bricks to create 30 centimeters of floor so that the dirt will not enter.

In the future he wants to complete school so that he will have to option of incorporating himself into the working world and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Meet Finda. She is 50 years old and from the eastern area of Jui in Freetown. She is married with five children. In 2003, Finda established her business, which she began because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that at present, her business is doing well.

Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Finda plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Oneyda Esperanza

texts.es: Oneyda, tiene 34 años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene una hija y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente vendía tortillas y hace 1 años  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para caballeros, damas y niños como ser  shorts, blusas, jeans, camisas, camisetas, vestidos etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela.  El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería de ropa de segunda mano como ser jeans, camisas, blusas, pantalones y ropa de niño,  para obtener mejor inventario y mejores ventas.  Ella piensa ahorrar para poder tener su propia casa y darle la educación a su hija.
texts.en: Oneyda is 34 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband.  They have a daughter and they live in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She used to sell tortillas, but one year ago she decided to sell men’s, women’s, and children’s used clothing, such as shorts, blouses, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc.  Her business is in her home and she has a good number of customers.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to invest in more merchandise such as second hand jeans, shirts, blouses, pants, and children’s clothing to have a better inventory and increase her sales.  She wants to save up to be able to have a home of her own and provide an education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es un hombre que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura para ayudar a su padre a llevar el alimento a su familia. No obstante, hoy que ya es padre de tres hijos, lo realiza con mayor empeño, además de la agricultura, tiene un empleo  en una granja donde funge como vigilante de las instalaciones, su esposa se dedica al 100% del cuidado de sus  hijos  y el quehacer del hogar.  

En el área agrícola la experiencia es basta, ya que desde muy corta edad al lado de su padre se ha dedicado  a labrar la tierra, en su empleo como vigilante la experiencia es de  2 años.

El préstamo será utilizado, para realizar el pago de una deuda que obtuvo para la construcción de su vivienda, la cual fue otorgada con intereses altos y le ocasiona serios problemas a la hora de mantener a su familia, por lo alto de los intereses. Con esta ayuda lograra nivelar su economía  y podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

En el futuro,  mediante sus hijos crezcan piensa realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda,  además de eso mantener a sus hijos motivados  a estudiar, proveerles todo lo necesario, para que en el futuro  sean profesionales de bien.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and has been working as a farmer since he was very young, helping his father feed his family.  Now he is a father himself, and has three children.  Aside from farming, he also works as a guard at another farm.  His wife is a fulltime mother and homemaker.

He has lots of farming experience, since he worked at his father’s side at a very young age.  He has been a guard for two years.

He will use the money from this loan to repay a construction loan for his home, which carries a high interest rate and causes him problems with supporting his family because of the high interest rate.  This assistance will help him level his finances and provide a better quality of life for his family.

In the future, as his children grow, he will make some improvements to his home.  He will also keep his children motivated to continue their educations, and provide them with all they need s that they can become professionals of means.

loans.use: to repay a previous loan.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2, Eastern Rural Area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She started her business to take care of her family.

Kadiatu runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, pure water and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes purchasing is very slow.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une jeune femme de 49 ans mariée , mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 26 ans. Tous vont déjà au collège. elle a ouvert et gère une boutique de vente emportée de boissons depuis 2 ans. son activité fonctionne mais elle manque souvent de stock parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité parce que son capital ne lui permet pas de faire autrement. Elle est obligée à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer un nouveau. D'où son besoin de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter des casiers de boisson . Le bénéfice lui permettra d'agrandir sa structure. Elle économisera le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Marguerite is a young woman, 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children, from 10 to 26 years old. Everyone has been to middle school. Marguerite opened a store and has been running it for two years selling take-out beverages. Her business is doing well, but she often lacks inventory to sell, since her capital does not allow otherwise. She is always compelled to sell her entire inventory in order to procure more, thus the need for a loan enabling her to have more cases of beverages. The profit will allow her to expand her organization. She will save the rest of the money for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks to sell

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 23 years.  She started her business for daily survival for her family.
 
Mbalu runs a cookery business, and she sells the products of her cookery within her area. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.   Mbalu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice for preparation in her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice for preparation in her cookery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two pigs and feed

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance through its Ishaka branch and has so far borrowed thrice all in effort to grow his business and increase his income base. He is a married man and he has two children. Leonard also stays with two dependants who are his parents and he says he feels obliged to give them the care they deserve since they helped him grow. His major source of income is the transport business where he uses a motorcycle to transport people to and from different places. He works five days in a week and works for ten hours every day worked. His work station is within Ishaka and he started the business with an aim of getting income to cater for the needs of his family. His clients are mainly passengers in the same area and his challenges are the risky ones who sometimes never pay after reaching their destinations. 

Despite the challenges, Leonard is hopeful that with his hard work he will be able to establish and sustain his family. 

Since he also sells coffee besides the main transport business, he would like to use the one million three hundred thousand shillings loan to buy a stock of  coffee beans which he will later sell at a profit since he does farming on a small-scale as well.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans to sell.

loans.name: Noral

texts.en: Norah is a resident of a village in Mbarara municipality with children. She got married when she was 17 years old to a man she loved, but their parents were against it. The husband had no source of income and looking after the children became a problem. She and her husband joined hands and got a loan from Ugafode that they used to start a small retail shop. This shop has grown, supporting the family's survival. They have also managed to build a house and they are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete it.

loans.use: To complete construction of her house

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband Johiruddin and their two children in their own kachha ( mud and straw made) house in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Johiruddin is 42 years old and a cycle-van puller by profession. He earns their livelihood by carrying goods and people in his cycle-van from one place to another. Both Hamida and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. One of their children goes to school and reads in class IV (Grade 4).  The other is below school-going age.

Hamida wants to give financial support to her husband and plans to grow potatoes. Hamida has heard about BJS and applied for the loan so that they can purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate in their land.  This business is very lucrative and has a good demand in the local market. They hope to get a good harvest and make a good profit from it.

They hope to upgrade their poor financial condition in future, give good education to their children, and expand their business with the profit generated.

loans.use: to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Shokat

texts.en:
Shokat is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children: two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to support them, which includes providing food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Shokat started her business sewing clothes to contribute in the family income, and she is well familiar with stitching techniques. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a new stitching machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons and needles, so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Belqees

texts.en: Belqees is a 27-year-old vigorous lady and mother of two children.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Slamah

texts.en:
Slamah is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Slamah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items. 

To help expand her business, Slamah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items to sell in the shop, and will help Slamah to generate greater profits and educate her children. Slamah hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a wholesale shop. 

Slamah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large quantities of materials, which will aid her in improving her business at large.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, trousers, dresses, blouses, e.t.c for his business.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is 34 years old, and he lives in a village called Beit Liqya-Beit Liqya, a Palestinian town located in the Ramallah and Al-Bireh Governorate in northern West Bank, which is 21 kilometers southwest of Ramallah. He lives with his wife, daughter and son, and one of his children attends primary school.

Iyad works in the public sector and his salary is around $500 per month. He asked Ryada for this loan to repair his house. He wants to repair the doors of the private rooms and the bathroom, and extend the electricity, which will help to warm his house, especially now in the winter. Iyad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the doors of the private rooms and the bathroom, and to extend electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials used to build a small sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, swimwear, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Susan           S

texts.en:
Meet Susan, a 35-year-old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  Over the past fifteen years, Susan established her fuel business within her community. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself.    She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Susan requires a loan in order to purchase more fuel to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Susan plans to open a fuel station. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fuel to expand her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 31, is from the Gardabani District. He is married with two toddler children and works as a constructor worker locally. Ali gets special orders and makes house renovations for his clients in return for a service fee. His earnings are hardly enough to cover food and household costs for the family of four. 

In order to generate income, Ali plans to start a business trading fruits and vegetables. With the loan amount, he will purchase fresh products in bulk and sell them on the local open market with a price mark-up. Ali owns an old car and will use it to make deliveries. Ali hopes his initiative will be lucrative and he will be able to increase family funds. Ali and his family members are waiting for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Ambrosio De Jesus

texts.es:
Ambrosio, está casado vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, debido a la necesidad de tener más ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, instalo una pequeña tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes. 
El capital lo invertirá en compra jabón, detergentes, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, etc., con esto el tendrá un inventario que le permitirá contar con productos variados para atraer a más clientes, le aumenten sus ventas y tener ganancias con las que mejorara su vida familiar y cancelara el crédito.
Su sueño es tener una tienda más amplia para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesitan y sean bien atendidos.
texts.en:
Ambrosio is married and lives with his wife in a home of his own.  He opened a small store where he sells primary needs products, because he needed more income.

He will use the money from this loan to buy soap, detergents, drinks, rice, sugar, snacks, etc. so that he will have inventory that will allow him to have products so he can serve more customers, increase his sales, and have a greater income so he can improve his family life and pay off the loan.  His dream is to have a larger store so that his customers can find what they need and be better served.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en:
Meet Kaday. She is 35 years old from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. In 2003, Kaday established her fish business. She began her business, because she wants to ensure her family's welfare. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is high competition in the market.

Kaday requires a loan in order to purchase more fish to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Kaday plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Selina, age 30, is a homemaker who lives with her husband in a small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri in their own kaccha house (a house made of straw, bamboo, mud, etc.)  She and her husband studied up to class VII (grade 7) and class IV (grade 4). They have two children who go to school.

 Saliina’s husband is a farmer. They have a plot of land where her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables and sells them at the market. Salina gives assistance to her husband in this work. Now they want to farm potatoes in this land. She is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming potatoes and to avoid contamination of insects and diseases. 

In the future with the profit, she dreams of buying more land for expanding her business. She hopes Kiva and BJS will give her extensive support in the near future.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a rural resident who is 35 years old. She is married and a housewife. She received education up to class VI (Grade 6). Her husband, Nidhi, age 40, is a cycle-van puller. He earns money by carrying goods and people. He is illiterate and can only sign his name. Jayanti is blessed with three children.

Jayanti lives with her family in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha (straw- and mud-made house). She gives education to all her children with great difficulty. They read in class VIII (Grade 8), class V (Grade 5) and class I (Grade 1).

Due to the small income of her husband, it has become very difficult for Jayanti to meet the food expenses and the cost of their children's education. So she applied for a loan to Belghoria Janakalyan Samity to help her purchase a cow with which she will be able to start a business of dairy products. She hopes to earn a profit from this business as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a dairy product business.

loans.name: Rakhi

texts.en:
Rakhi is a 33-year-old housewife.  She is married to Ranjan and they are raising two children (one son and one daughter) together. They live in their own concrete house in Dhupguri town in the district Jalpaiguri. Rakhi and her husband both have completed higher secondary education (grade 12). Their son goes to school and their daughter is too small to go to school. 

Rakhi started her business selling sarees (an Indian dress) some time ago, selling mainly to her friends, neighbors, and acquaintances. Her saree business is not good enough to support a decent lifestyle.  She would like to get a loan to buy many varieties of sarees and expand her business to meet her customers' needs as well as to upgrade their financial condition. The profits generated will be used to build up her savings and also help her to give her child a better education. Her dream is to purchase a shop in the local market in order to expand their business.

Rakhi is a lady with great enthusiasm and never wants to stop struggling. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase many varieties of Sarees (an Indian dress) to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 37 years old and has two children. She rears pigs and grows maize. She began the business to get money to look after her family. 

She will use the loan to buy feed for the pigs and to expand the project. She hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. Her challenge is natural calamities. She is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Meet Ramatu; she is a 37-year-old from Jui Eastern Area in Freetown. She is married with four children. In 2010, Ramatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to maintain her family. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business is insufficient capital to expand.

Ramatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Ramatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Dipti is 35-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband Uttam and their only son at Tekatuli in the small town Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Dipti is a housewife and she received education up to class VIII (grade 8). Her husband Uttam studied up to class IX (Grade 9).  Their only son receives education and reads in Class VII (Grade 7).   They live in their own pacca (brick-built) house.

Dipti's husband Uttam is a farmer.  He works hard on the family-owned land, growing green vegetables. He always has high quality produce, which is sold locally. But he has to face tough competition with the other greengrocers.  So he does not get enough profit to cope with the financial stringency to run his family well. So they thought to switch over to another business.

Dipti heard that BJS offers loans to women in the community, so she applied for a loan to help her husband to buy a cow.  Their plan is to start a business selling milk as well as dairy products in the locality.  These are in good demand in their locality.

Dipti hopes that the profit she will get from the business will give good support to upgrade their financial condition and to give her child better education. Her dream is to make a pacca (brick-built) sanitary latrine in their house.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start a dairy product business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a permanent resident of Rwendama, a surburb in Kiruhura District, aged 42 years old. He is married with eight children and two dependents from his brother, who died three years ago. All his children and dependents are in school. He was a police officer but retired early because he was injured in an accident.  

After his retirement, James resorted to poultry farming which enabled him to also set up a banana plantation. This made him prosper in life and he even managed to build a semi-permanent house to accommodate his family.  He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy pesticides and manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and manure

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es: Luis, tiene 63 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de  Puerto Cortes.  Luis trabajo varios años en una maquila y hace 3 años que se dedica a la ebanistería donde hace puertas, ventana, armarios, ropero, esquinera, divisiones, etc. Todo en madera.  Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y por pedidos. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y es por 15, 000 Lempiras  el cual  va invertir en la compra de  maderas  para poder seguir trabajando fabricando muebles de madera y vender.  Tiene como  meta  crecer con su negocio y tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en: Luis is 63 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the town of Puerto Cortes.  Luis used to work at a factory that makes products for export, but has been working as a furniture maker for three years, where he makes doors, windows, armoires, clothing cabinets, end tables, room dividers, etc., all out of wood.  He does this out of his home and to order.  This will be his third loan through ODEF, for 15,000 Lempiras which he will use to buy lumber to be able to work making and selling wooden furniture.  His goal is to grow his business and have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Martha, tiene 36 años de edad,  esta casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de  Choloma, Cortes. Martha trabajo por varios años en una empresa siempre en confección, donde adquirió experiencia y hace 12 años pudo poner su propio taller de confección de  ropa. Este taller lo tiene en su casa y confecciona blusas, vestidos, pantalones y uniformes. El préstamo es el quinto ciclo y es por 21,000 Lempira, con el cual va invertir en la compra de  materiales como ser hilos, telas, agujas, broches, elásticos, botones, zippers, etc. Para poder cumplir con los pedidos y mantener materiales en existencia. Su meta es lograr crecer con el negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en: Martha is 36 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  Martha worked for several years as a seamstress for another company, where she gained lots of experience.  12 years ago she decided to set up her own workshop in her home, where she makes blouses, dresses, pants, and uniforms.  This will be her fifth loan and this one is for 21,000 Lempiras, which she will use to buy supplies such as threads, fabrics, needles, clips, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc., so she can fill her orders and keep materials on hand.  Her goal is to grow her business and for her children to complete their educations.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, es un agricultor de profesión, ya que desde los 7 años acompaño a su padre a realizar todas las tareas de la agricultura, adoptándolas a la perfección; Por la situación económica del país  en el años  2006, decidió viajar a los estados unidos, esperando  encontrar ahí  el muy ansiado sueño americano, desilusionándose y después de 4 años regreso a El Salvador, con algunos ahorros que le permitieron comprar un vehículo, para trabajar de lleno en la agricultura, cuando  regreso  al país se acompañó y ha procreado un hijo de 3 años. 

La experiencia en materia de agricultura es grande, más en granos básicos, en el área de manejo de  aves,  su experiencia es de 15 años; ya que  trabajo  en una granja de aves ponedoras antes de viajar a los estados unidos.

El préstamo lo utilizara, para establecer un módulo de aves ponedoras, ya que ha estudiado el mercado de su comunidad  y existe una demanda de este producto y tiene la idea de abastecer  a tiendas y comedores de la ciudad, las aves de un día de nacidas y el concentrado los comprara a 25 minutos de su casa en vehículo.  

En el futuro,  planea establecer  una clientela de este producto e ir incrementando  gradualmente la producción, esta actividad le permitirá, a medida su hijo crezca, ir enseñándole este trabajo para que en el futuro  tenga una herramienta para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and is a farmer by profession.  Since age seven he worked with his father, doing all the farm tasks and adopting them to perfection.  Because of the country’s economic situation in 2006, he decided to travel to the United States, hoping to find his oldest American dream there.  Having become disillusioned after four years, he returned to El Salvador with some savings that allowed him to buy a farm vehicle.  When he returned to the country, he got married and now has a three year old son.

He has lots of experience as a farmer, especially in basic grains and managing poultry.  He has 15 years’ experience, since he worked at an egg laying chicken farm before going to the United States.  

He will use the money from this loan to set up an egg-laying chicken farm, since he has studied the market in his community and there is a demand for this product.  He has the idea that he wants to supply stores and restaurants in the city.  He will buy day old chicks and feed from a place located 25 minutes from his home.

In the future he plans to set up customers for this product and gradually increase production.  This will allow him to teach his son as he gets older, so that he will have the tools to get ahead in the future.

loans.use: to set up a chicken farm.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a very hardworking 25-year-old housewife from a small village of Dhupguri town, District Jalpaiguri, and mother of one child. She received education until class X (Grade 10).  Her child is too small to go to school.

Asma’s husband, Eajul, is a farmer, associated with the cultivation business. They have their own land near their home. Due to lack of finances, they haven't been able to do any business on that land. So, Asma decided to take out a loan and start potato cultivation, as potato is a vegetable that is much in demand in West Bengal and her husband has knowledge about potato cultivation.  With this loan she wants to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

She gives hearty thanks to Kiva and BJS for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es: Florinda , tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Hace 13 años que se dedica a la venta de tortillas y presta el servicio de moler maíz y coco en un molino. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos para su negocio, el préstamo que solicita es por 16,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de un molino nuevo para moler maíz y prestar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ganancias.  Su meta es ayudar a su familia y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Florinda is 57 years old, a single mother with three children, and lives in the town of Puerto Cortes.  She has been selling tortillas for 13 years and also grids corn and coconut for customers in her mill.  This business is out of her home and she is asking for a loan of 16,000 Lempiras to buy a new mill to grind corn, provide better service, and obtain better earnings.  Her goal is to help her family and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is 45 years old and she is married with two children, ages 27 and 25. Many years ago, she established her tailor shop. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Bimala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailor shop.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 8 and 7.  Many years ago, she established  her tailoring shop.  Working six days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Lalita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth materials or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Lilian Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Lilian es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, desde hace 5 años.
